characters.name: Eiichiro Oda
characters.notable_info: Creator of One Piece
characters.short_bio: Eiichiro Oda, born January 1, 1975 in Kumamoto City, Kumamoto Prefecture in Japan, is a professional mangaka, best known as the creator of the manga One Piece. A dedicated writer and artist since adolescence, Oda began working for Shueisha's Shonen Jump at 17 and currently stands as one of the world's most prominent mangaka, earning an estimated ¥3.1 billion (US$23 million) per year. Despite his rigorous work schedule, he maintains steady correspondence with fans (and the wider public) through both formal interviews and informal channels such as his SBS columns.

characters.name: Anjo
characters.short_bio: Anjo is a pirate admirer who witnessed Gol D. Roger's execution.

characters.name: Daz Bonez
characters.short_bio: "The Killer" Daz Bonez, alias Mr. 1, is a former bounty hunter and the former highest-ranked male Officer Agent of Baroque Works. His partner was Miss Doublefinger. After escaping Impel Down, he traveled with Crocodile in the New World and later joined Crocodile's new organization, Cross Guild. He was a major antagonist during the Arabasta Arc and a tentative ally in the Impel Down and Marineford Arcs.

characters.name: Islewan
characters.short_bio: Islewan is an infamous New World pirate captain who was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates, before forming his own crew subordinate to Whitebeard.

characters.name: Portgas D. Ace
characters.japanese_name: ポートガス・D・エース
characters.notable_info: Son of Gol D. Roger, adopted brother of Luffy, died protecting Luffy at Marineford
characters.short_bio: Portgas D. Ace, born as Gol D. Ace and nicknamed "Fire Fist" Ace, was the captain of the Spade Pirates before being recruited into the Whitebeard Pirates and becoming its 2nd division commander. The biological son of the late Pirate King Gol D. Roger and Portgas D. Rouge, Ace was put in the care of Monkey D. Garp and Curly Dadan after Roger's death, which is where he became the sworn brother of Monkey D. Luffy and Sabo. Due to Roger's absence from his life, Ace disowned his father and took his mother's surname, ultimately declaring that his captain Whitebeard was his true father. Ace's pursuit of his former subordinate Blackbeard for the murder of their crewmate Thatch led to him being captured after their duel on Banaro Island, and he was turned in to the Marines, who held a public execution for him on Marineford due to his heritage; this triggered the Summit War of Marineford. While freed from bondage, Ace would ultimately lose his life at the hands of Admiral Akainu while protecting Luffy. Ace's death proved the final catalyst following the Straw Hats' defeat at Sabaody that would make Luffy put his crew's journey on hiatus so they could all train for the next two years and return powerful enough to survive the New World on their own, paving the way for the second half of the series. His reincarnated Devil Fruit would eventually be consumed by his sworn brother, Sabo, ensuring that his will would live on. Ace first appeared at the end of the Drum Island Arc, but was only formally introduced in the Arabasta Arc, where he acts as a brief ally of the Straw Hat Pirates. He is a central figure during the entire Summit War Saga. He is also the protagonist of Ace's Great Blackbeard Search cover arc.

characters.name: Peeply Lulu
characters.short_bio: Peepley Lulu is one of the five foremen of the Galley-La Company's Dock 1 in Water 7. His specialties as a shipwright are pitch, block and tackle, and blacksmithing. He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 Arc and the beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc.

characters.name: Aisa
characters.short_bio: Aisa is a young Shandia girl who used to sneak onto the Upper Yard frequently to collect Vearth. She is Isa's daughter. After the timeskip, she works in the Wagomuland theme park and sells Cloud Balloons.

characters.name: Iceburg
characters.short_bio: Iceburg is the president of the Galley-La Company and the mayor of Water 7. He was formerly one of Tom's Workers, being one of Tom's two apprentices alongside Franky. He is a central character for the Water 7 Arc and the Water 7 Saga as a whole, due to being the original inheritor of the Pluton blueprints given to him by Tom which CP9 sought after.

characters.name: Lassoo

devil_fruit.name: Mutt-Mutt Fruit, Model: Dachshund
devil_fruit.japanese_name: Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Dachshund

characters.short_bio: Lassoo is Mr. 4's gun that consumed a Devil Fruit through some unknown method which allows it to become a living dog. He is classified as a Type D creature, "Small Savage".

characters.name: Peterman
characters.short_bio: Peterman is the head of a kidnapping gang called the Hound Pets, located in Sabaody Archipelago, and a minor antagonist of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc.

characters.name: Ulti

devil_fruit.name: Dragon-Dragon Fruit, Model: Pachycephalosaurus
devil_fruit.japanese_name: Ryu Ryu no Mi, Model: Pachycephalosaurus

characters.short_bio: Ulti is a former member of the Tobiroppo, the six strongest Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates. She is the elder sister of fellow former Tobiroppo Page One, and the daughter of a former Warlord of the Sea, Hanafuda. Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc. Following the downfall of the Beasts Pirates however, Ulti swore loyalty to Yamato for saving her and Page One from Who's-Who and became one of his allies in the Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Strawberry
characters.short_bio: Vice Admiral Strawberry is a Marine officer, and one of the five vice admirals who led the Buster Call assault on Enies Lobby.

characters.name: Oimo
characters.short_bio: Oimo is a giant from Elbaph and a member of the Giant Warrior Pirates under Dorry and Brogy. He has a grandson attending the Walrus School on Elbaph; Olav. After being captured by the Marines 50 years ago, he and his comrade Kashii were tricked into serving as the guards of Enies Lobby's main gate. During the Enies Lobby Arc, Oimo and Kashii defected against the World Government and allied themselves with the Straw Hat Pirates, Galley-La Company, and Franky Family. During the Egghead Arc, Oimo and Kashii became major allies of the Straw Hat Pirates as members of the Giant Warrior Pirates.

characters.name: Tilestone
characters.short_bio: Tilestone is one of the five foremen of Dock One of the Galley-La Company in Water 7. Tilestone is the last of the foremen to be formally introduced in the story, although he is present from the first scene Galley-La is shown in. His specialties are cabinetry, caulking, and flag making. He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 Arc and the beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc.

characters.name: Mozu
characters.short_bio: Mozu and Kiwi, also known as the Square Sisters due to their square-like hairstyle, are two members of the Franky Family very loyal to Franky, who went with him everywhere and tended to mimic every pose he did. They are both allies of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 and beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc (starting off as minor antagonists in the former). Currently, they jointly manage Blueno's old bar in Water 7.

characters.name: Emporio Ivankov
characters.japanese_name: エンポリオ・イワンコフ
characters.short_bio: Emporio Ivankov, or Iva for short, is the "Queen" of the Kamabakka Kingdom, known as "Okama King" and a "Miracle Person". He is one of the Revolutionary Army's founding members, as well as the commander of the G Army, which covers the Grand Line. A former slave of the World Nobles, he escaped during the Native Hunting Competition on God Valley and was responsible for the God Valley Incident along with Ginny. He was formerly a prisoner of Impel Down, where he was kept in Level 5, but lived in the secret "Okama Paradise" in Level 5.5. After escaping Impel Down and participating in the Summit War of Marineford, he returned to his post as Queen of Kamabakka Kingdom. He acts as an ally of Luffy during the Impel Down and Marineford Arcs.

characters.name: General Franky
characters.short_bio: The is the newest addition to the Battle Franky line, numbered BF-38.

characters.name: Ivan X
characters.short_bio: The Super Spot-Billed Duck Troops are a family of seven Super Spot-Billed Ducks (and later one camel) who serve the kingdom of Arabasta. They are led by their captain Karoo, and are reputed to be the fastest troop in the kingdom of Arabasta. All of the ducks have the strange theme of wearing different types of hats and various other jewelry and clothing. Also strange was that the last member to join the squad, Matsuge, is a camel who helped the Straw Hats confront Baroque Works.

characters.name: Mountblutain
characters.short_bio: Mounblutain was a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who masqueraded as Sogeking.

characters.name: Pickles
characters.short_bio: Pickles, also known as the "Tackle Machine", is a former combatant of the Groggy Monsters of the Foxy Pirates. Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist of the Long Ring Long Land Arc.

characters.name: Eustass Kid
characters.notable_info: Worst Generation pirate, magnetic powers, rivals Luffy
characters.short_bio: Eustass "Captain" Kid is a notorious pirate from the South Blue and the captain of the Kid Pirates. He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation". Kid first appeared at the Sabaody Archipelago at the same time Monkey D. Luffy and his crew arrived. Both were described as members of the "Eleven Supernovas", pirates who had congregated on the island who all had a bounty of more than 100,000,000. After briefly fighting alongside Luffy while escaping an attack by the Marines, he fled the archipelago and would later spectate the Summit War of Marineford alongside the other Supernovas. During Luffy's two years of training, Kid challenged one of the Four Emperors, Shanks, but lost one of his arms to Benn Beckman in the process. He attempted to form an alliance with the On Air Pirates and Hawkins Pirates to challenge the Red Hair Pirates once more, but the alliance fell apart after an attack from another Emperor, Kaidou, which led to his imprisonment at Wano Country where he would eventually reunite with Luffy. Though nominally acting in self-interest towards vengeance and glory, Kid's assistance towards the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance was instrumental in defeating Kaidou, Big Mom and the Beasts Pirates. After leaving Wano, Kid and his crew arrived at Elbaph and decided to challenge Shanks once more. However, the entire crew and their ship were decimated by Shanks and his allies, Dorry and Brogy. Kid was originally introduced with a bounty of 315,000,000, largely due to a high number of civilian casualties caused by him and his crew, thus exceeding Luffy's when they first arrived at the Sabaody Archipelago. Sometime during the timeskip, his bounty was raised from 315,000,000 to 470,000,000. Kid's bounty was eventually raised to 3,000,000,000 for his role in defeating Big Mom of the Four Emperors alongside Trafalgar Law during the Raid on Onigashima. Due to his actions, Kid can be considered a minor ally during the Sabaody Archipelago Arc as well as a major ally during the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Otohime
characters.short_bio: Queen Otohime was a goldfish mermaid, the queen of the Ryugu Kingdom, the wife of king Neptune, and the mother of Fukaboshi, Ryuboshi, Manboshi, and Shirahoshi. Otohime was a political activist who worked hard for union and peace between fish-men plus merfolk and humans, dreaming of having her people emigrate from the Sea Floor to the surface. Ten years ago, she was assassinated by Hody Jones, who had framed a human pirate as the instigator of the deed. She is one of the two posthumous overarching protagonists of the Fish-Man Island Arc (alongside Fisher Tiger).

characters.name: Itomimizu
characters.short_bio: Itomimizu is the former Foxy Pirates' game official and serves as the announcer and commentator of the Davy Back Fight events. He rides on a very large bird named Chuchun.

characters.name: Hiriluk
characters.short_bio: Dr. Hiriluk was a quack doctor from Drum Island, as well as Tony Tony Chopper's father figure. He was also a former thief. He died seven years ago by drinking an explosive formula—a form of preemptive suicide, as his life was already curtailed by both disease and external threats.

characters.name: Ikaros Much
characters.short_bio: Ikaros Much is a giant squid fish-man and was an officer of the New Fish-Man Pirates before their downfall and disbandment. Due to his actions and role, he is considered to be a major antagonist in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

characters.name: Sweet Pea
characters.short_bio: Sweet Pea is a member of the Kuja tribe living on the island Amazon Lily. During the timeskip, she became a member of the Kuja Pirates.

characters.name: A O
characters.short_bio: A O is an infamous New World pirate and captain of the A O Pirates. He and his crew were subordinates to Whitebeard.

characters.name: Boodle
characters.short_bio: Boodle is the mayor of Orange Town. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Orange Town Arc.

characters.name: Capone Bege
characters.short_bio: Capone "Gang" Bege is a mafia don-turned-pirate and the captain of the Fire Tank Pirates. He is also one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation". He and his crew came from West Blue, where Bege was one of the heads of the Five Families of the West. During the timeskip, he became a subordinate of Charlotte Linlin and married Charlotte Chiffon. The two have a son named Capone Pez. While working under the Big Mom Pirates, he held a position of a rook-ranked combatant. Due to his allegiance and actions, he is the secondary antagonist of the Zou Arc. Later, Bege formed a temporary alliance with the Straw Hat Pirates in order to kill Big Mom during the Whole Cake Island Arc. After his plan failed, Bege effectively became an enemy of the Emperor and her crew. Sometime during the timeskip, his bounty increased from 138,000,000 to 300,000,000. After the events of the Whole Cake Island Arc, it has increased to 350,000,000. He is also one of the central characters in "Gang" Bege's Oh My Family Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Splash
characters.short_bio: Splash and Splatter are two newkama pirate twins. They both willingly donated blood to Sanji when he was dying of severe blood loss.

characters.name: Splatter
characters.short_bio: Splash and Splatter are two newkama pirate twins. They both willingly donated blood to Sanji when he was dying of severe blood loss.

characters.name: Kouzuki Toki
characters.short_bio: Kouzuki Toki, née Amatsuki, was the wife of the daimyo of Kuri, Kouzuki Oden and the mother of Kouzuki Momonosuke and Kouzuki Hiyori. She was born around 830 years before the present day. By the time she was 26 years old, she jumped forward in time with her Devil Fruit ability and arrived 30 years before the present when she met Oden and stayed with him for 10 years until he was executed. She was killed during the destruction of Oden Castle.

characters.name: Spandine
characters.short_bio: Spandine is the father of Spandam and was CP9's chief 22 years ago during the Ohara Incident. He led the "investigation" in Ohara and was responsible for summoning the Buster Call. Presently, his political power within the World Government is weakening due to an unknown disease he has been stricken with. At some point later, his sickness led to him losing all of his authority within the government.

characters.name: Kinderella
characters.short_bio: Kinderella, also known as Miss Universe, is a woman who married Wapol after he became the head of his own corporation. Two years after that, she became the queen of the Evil Black Drum Kingdom when Wapol became its king.

characters.name: Antonio
characters.short_bio: :For the non-canon character of the same name, see Antonio (Non-Canon) Antonio is the owner of "Antonio's Graman" in Sabaody Archipelago.

characters.name: Miss Friday
characters.short_bio: Miss Friday is a vulture and a member of the criminal organization Baroque Works, being a part of along with Mr. 13. They were a team that served as messengers for Mr. 0 and were also responsible for executing any Baroque Works agents that fail their missions. She is classified as Type D creatures, "Small Savage".

characters.name: Going Merry
characters.japanese_name: ゴーイング・メリー号
characters.short_bio: The Going Merry was the first full-sized ship owned by the Straw Hat Pirates, a caravel that served as their main transportation through the East Blue, and the Grand Line up until Water 7. It was often affectionally referred to as simply Merry by the crew. Originally designed by Kaya's servant Merry, it was gifted to the Straw Hats for defending Syrup Village against the Black Cat Pirates. Over time, it came to be loved by the crew as a home and as a friend, so much so that she eventually developed a life of her own and became a genuine crew member. Unfortunately, the Going Merry took an inordinate amount of damage during her "lifetime", being blown up, impaled, sliced up multiple times, and partially eaten by Wapol. Eventually, the Merry could no longer continue and after helping the Straw Hats escape Enies Lobby, it received a Viking funeral. After destruction, the Merry was succeeded by the Thousand Sunny, a ship specially built by Franky (and the Galley-La Company) to maintain the "soul" of its predecessor.

characters.name: Capone Pez
characters.short_bio: Capone "Gang" Pez is the infant son of Capone Bege and Charlotte Chiffon, as well as the grandson of Charlotte Linlin and Pound.

characters.name: Charlotte Basskarte
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・バスカルテ
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Basskarte (WT100) Charlotte Basskarte is the 13th son and 22nd child of the Charlotte Family and the middle triplet brother of Nusstorte and Dosmarche. He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.

characters.name: Charlotte Dosmarche
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・ドスマルシェ
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Dosmarche is the 14th son and 23rd child of the Charlotte Family and the younger triplet brother of Nusstorte and Basskarte. He also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Tea, governing over Black Island.

characters.name: Charlotte Nusstorte
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・ニューストルテ
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Nusstorte is the 12th son and 21st child of the Charlotte Family and the eldest triplet brother of Basskarte and Dosmarche. He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Transport, governing over Package Island.

characters.name: Ginrummy
characters.short_bio: Ginrummy is a Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates.

characters.name: Roxanne
characters.short_bio: Roxanne is a Baratie regular who was friendly with Sanji.

characters.name: Gild Tesoro
characters.short_bio: Gild Tesoro, also known as the "Golden Emperor", was the owner and proprietor of Gran Tesoro, the largest entertainment city-ship in the world. Formerly a slave of the World Nobles, Tesoro became a global kingpin with dealings with the World Government and the Underworld infamously known as the "Monster of the New World" and one of the wealthiest people in the world. He served as the main antagonist of One Piece Film: Gold, during which he invited the Straw Hat Pirates aboard his ship as part of an elaborate show to enslave and execute them in lavish fashion, only to meet a crushing defeat by Monkey D. Luffy and be subsequently arrested by the Marines.

characters.name: Kairiken
characters.short_bio: Kairiken is a bounty hunter at Sabaody Archipelago.

characters.name: Miss Monday
characters.short_bio: Miss Monday is the code name of a former frontier agent of Baroque Works and partner to Igaram (Mr. 8 at the time) during his infiltration of Baroque Works. Due to her actions, she is a supporting antagonist in the Whisky Peak Arc. After the fall of Baroque Works, she stayed at Whisky Peak, and eventually bore a son with Mr. 9.

characters.name: Giolla
characters.notable_info: Art-Art Fruit user, can transform anything into abstract art
characters.short_bio: Giolla is an officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Trebol Army. Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Kuromarimo
characters.short_bio: Kuromarimo was the magistrate during Wapol's rule on Drum Island, and was the highest-ranking law officer below Wapol. After fleeing Drum Island to escape Blackbeard's attack, Kuromarimo became part of the Bliking Pirates. Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Drum Island Arc.

characters.name: Nero
characters.short_bio: Nero the Sea Weasel was the newest agent of CP9. He was first introduced on the Puffing Tom, where he helped to escort Nico Robin to Enies Lobby. He was one of the antagonists during the Sea Train voyage in the Water 7 Arc.

characters.name: Charlotte Chiffon
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・シフォン
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Chiffon is the 22nd daughter and the 52nd child of the Charlotte Family and Totto Land's former Minister of Puff having governed over Funwari Island until her defection. She is Capone Bege's wife and the mother of Capone Pez, as well as a member of Bege's Fire Tank Pirates. Her father is Big Mom's 25th ex-husband, Pound, and her younger twin sister is Lola. Due to her resemblance to Lola, Chiffon was abused by Big Mom in her rage for Lola abandoning an arranged marriage. This led to Chiffon cutting ties to her blood family and helping Bege in his attempt to assassinate her own mother, which caused Big Mom herself and most of Chiffon's siblings to identify her as an enemy. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Whole Cake Island Arc. She is also one of the central characters in "Gang" Bege's Oh My Family Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Lola
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Lola is the captain of the Rolling Pirates and the 23rd daughter and 53rd child of the Charlotte Family. Her mother is the former Emperor Charlotte Linlin and her father is Linlin's 25th husband, Pound. She is the younger twin sister of Chiffon and Gotti's wife. She was Totto Land's Minister of Chocolate before she ran away after being arranged to marry Prince Loki of Elbaph. Wanting to marry for love, she proposed so many times to the point of being called "Marriage Proposal Lola" until she finally married Gotti. She was a member of the Thriller Bark Victim's Association after her shadow was stolen by Gecko Moria and placed into a warthog zombie also named Lola. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Thriller Bark Arc. She is also one of the central characters in "Gang" Bege's Oh My Family Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Mansherry
characters.short_bio: Mansherry is a dwarf and the princess of the Tontatta Kingdom. She is the daughter of Gancho, the king of the Tontatta Kingdom.

characters.name: Kin'emon
characters.short_bio: '''"Foxfire" Kin'emon''' is a samurai from the region of Kuri in Wano Country who currently serves the shogunate as a great elder in the Flower Capital. Once a thug in his youth, he became a retainer of the Kouzuki Family and the leader of Kouzuki Oden's Nine Red Scabbards. He was born 56 years before the present day, but traveled 20 years forward in time when he was 36 years old. Due to Wano Country having been taken over by Kurozumi Orochi, an ally of Kaidou of the Four Emperors, Kin'emon set out on a seafaring quest to recruit warriors for his cause, bringing alongside him his master, Kouzuki Momonosuke, as well as two of his comrades. After a series of misadventures, Kin'emon ended up on the island of Punk Hazard, where he met and joined forces with the Straw Hat Pirates, posing as Momonosuke's father during the journey to Zou. He is one of the central allies of the Straw Hats during the Dressrosa, Whole Cake Island and Wano Country Sagas.

characters.name: Domo-kun
characters.short_bio: Domo-kun and Nnke-kun are aliens planning to conquer the Earth. They are the first joke characters created by Oda. They first appeared in Oda's short story Future Present from God. Later Domo-kun makes an appearance among the Buggy Pirates. Oda answered a question in an SBS and drew both of them. Nnke-kun appeared again alongside Pandaman on the cover of Volume 52.

characters.name: Suleiman
characters.affiliation: Beautiful Pirates / Straw Hat Grand Fleet
characters.short_bio: Suleiman the Beheader is a war criminal who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi. He eventually joined the Beautiful Pirates, serving under Cavendish. He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Aladine
characters.short_bio: Aladine is a goatsbeard brotula merman. He was originally a Ryugu Kingdom soldier who was then enslaved, but then became a pirate as the doctor and later first mate of the Sun Pirates. He is the husband of Charlotte Praline, serving as the bond between the Sun Pirates and the Charlotte Family.

characters.name: An Zengaiina
characters.short_bio: An Zengaiina is a prisoner on Level 2 of Impel Down.

characters.name: Ipponmatsu
characters.short_bio: Ipponmatsu is the owner of an arms shop in Loguetown and Ipponume's husband. He was the former owner of both Sandai Kitetsu and Yubashiri.

characters.name: Brogy
characters.short_bio: Brogy the Red Ogre is a giant from Elbaph and one of the two captains of the Giant Warrior Pirates alongside Dorry. Once an active and infamous threat in the seas long ago, Brogy became embroiled in a personal duel over a trivial dispute with his best friend and co-captain Dorry. This duel on Little Garden lasted for a century before being interrupted by the arrival of the Straw Hat Pirates and the machinations of Baroque Works. After finally settling their duel the two giant captains returned to Elbaph and their crew, and later became involved in the Egghead Incident to rescue the Straw Hat Pirates and bring them to safety to Elbaph. A century ago his bounty was 100,000,000, but due to years of inflation and a return to active piracy his bounty was updated to 1,800,000,000. He is a major ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Little Garden, Egghead, and Elbaph Arcs. However, after being transformed into a demon by Imu, he became a minor antagonist during the Elbaph Arc.

characters.name: Doma
characters.short_bio: "Bohemian Knight" Doma is an infamous New World pirate who worked for Whitebeard.

characters.name: Elizabello II
characters.short_bio: "The Fighting King" Elizabello II is the king of the Prodence Kingdom. He is also a fighter who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi. He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Killer

devil_fruit.name: Smile (failed)
devil_fruit.power: None (failed, took away ability to swim and express negative emotions)

characters.short_bio: "Massacre Soldier" Killer is a pirate from the South Blue and a combatant of the Kid Pirates. He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation". After the timeskip, his bounty has been raised from 162,000,000 to 200,000,000. Following the confrontation with Kaidou, Killer ate a defective SMILE and took on the alias of Kamazo the Manslayer, a street murderer in Wano Country who secretly acted as an assassin working for the shogun, Kurozumi Orochi, until the shogun discarded him after he had failed his mission to kill Toko. He later reunites with his crew and becomes an ally member of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance during the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Nefertari Vivi
characters.short_bio: <!-- Do not add D. --> Nefertari Vivi is the princess of the Arabasta Kingdom. She is the daughter of Nefertari Cobra and Titi, and along with the rest of her family, she bears the initial D. in her name. During her childhood, Vivi was part of the Sand-Sand Clan, being the vice-leader of the group led by her friend Koza. Vivi debuted as one of the main antagonists of the Reverse Mountain Arc as a Bounty Hunter, under the Baroque Works codename Miss Wednesday. During this time, she was partnered with fellow Frontier Agent, Mr. 9. However, after the events of the Whisky Peak Arc, Vivi and her pet duck Karoo ended up joining the Straw Hat Pirates for most of the Arabasta Saga once she was discovered to be a spy plotting against Baroque Works. Vivi left the Straw Hats after defeating Baroque Works to stay in her home country, but is still considered a member of the crew and has been keeping track of their progress throughout the series. After attending the most recent Levely, she became a fugitive after Imu and the Five Elders learned she carried the "D." initial, and was forced to flee Mary Geoise and take shelter alongside Wapol aboard Morgans' airship.

characters.name: Ninjin
characters.short_bio: Ninjin (Odex) Miki Fukui, Aiko Hibi Ninjin is a former member of the Usopp Pirates, along with Piiman and Tamanegi, before Usopp joined the Straw Hat Pirates. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Syrup Village Arc.

characters.name: Bizarre
characters.short_bio: Bizarre is an infamous New World pirate captain who was allied with Whitebeard.

characters.name: Brownbeard
characters.short_bio: Chadros Higelyges, better known as Brownbeard, is a former New World pirate. After Whitebeard's death he went off and took control of Foodvalten, one of the New World islands formerly under Whitebeard's protection. After his defeat at the hands of Basil Hawkins, he quit being a pirate and resided on Punk Hazard, where he became the boss of the Centaur Patrol Unit which guarded part of the island, until his "Master" Caesar Clown betrayed him. He is a minor antagonist-turned-ally during the Punk Hazard Arc.

characters.name: Fuza
characters.short_bio: Fuza is the giant Three-length Bird of the Skypiean Priest Shura, who rode on it to get around to the different places throughout Skypiea.

characters.name: Sasaki

devil_fruit.name: Dragon-Dragon Fruit, Model: Triceratops
devil_fruit.japanese_name: Ryu Ryu no Mi, Model: Triceratops

characters.short_bio: "Overflowing" Sasaki is a bluespine unicornfish fish-man and one of the Tobiroppo, the strongest six Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates. He also leads the crew's Armored Division. Before joining the Beasts Pirates, he captained his own crew called the Sasaki Pirates. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Fujin
characters.short_bio: Fujin is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates. He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi. Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Fukaboshi
characters.short_bio: Fukaboshi is a shark merman and the eldest son of the royal Neptune Family on Fish-Man Island. After he, his father and his brothers were liberated by the Straw Hat Pirates, he allied himself with them against Hody Jones and his crew.

characters.name: Gloriosa
characters.short_bio: Gloriosa, more commonly known as "Elder Nyon", is an advisor of sorts to the current empress of the Kuja tribe, Boa Hancock. Gloriosa is a former empress and captain of the Kuja Pirates from three generations prior to Hancock. She is also a former member of the legendary Rocks Pirates.

characters.name: Haruta
characters.short_bio: Haruta is the former 12th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.

characters.name: Blamenco
characters.short_bio: Blamenco is the former 6th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.

characters.name: Vista
characters.short_bio: "Vista of the Flower Swords" is the former 5th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates. He is one of the most prominent members of his crew.

characters.name: Blondie
characters.short_bio: Blondie is an infamous New World pirate who was allied with Whitebeard.

characters.name: Nico Olvia
characters.short_bio: Nico Olvia was the mother of Nico Robin, the older sister of Oran and paternal aunt of Mizuira, and an archaeologist from Ohara who studied the Poneglyphs two decades ago. While travelling around the ocean with a group of fellow archaeologists, Olvia was captured by the Marines for conducting forbidden research. She was able to return to Ohara and briefly reunite with her daughter with the help of Jaguar D. Saul, before perishing alongside the other Ohara archaeologists due to the Buster Call.

characters.name: Nico Robin
characters.notable_info: Archaeologist who can read Poneglyphs, former Baroque Works agent
characters.short_bio: Nico Robin, also known by her epithet "Devil Child" and the "Light of the Revolution", is the archaeologist of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. She is the seventh member of the crew and the sixth to join, doing so at the end of the Arabasta Arc. She temporarily left the crew during the Water 7 Arc but rejoined during the Enies Lobby Arc. Born into a family of archaeologists, Robin is the daughter of Nico Olvia. Robin ate the Hana Hana no Mi at a young age, giving her the power to reproduce her body parts (or her entire body) on any surface at will. As the sole survivor of the destroyed West Blue island Ohara, she is currently one of only two people in the world known to have the ability to read and decipher Poneglyphs, a skill which is considered forbidden and threatening to the World Government. She acted as the vice president of Baroque Works as "Miss All Sunday", serving and partnering herself directly with the organization's president; the ex-Warlord: Crocodile, who operated under the codename "Mr. 0". She was the secondary antagonist of the Arabasta Arc and Saga, before joining the Straw Hats. Her dream is to find the Rio Poneglyph which tells the true history of the world, specifically the Void Century. She gained a bounty of 79,000,000 at the age of 8 due to her ability to read poneglyphs after the destruction of Ohara. It later increased to 80,000,000 after the Straw Hats invaded Enies Lobby to rescue her and escape. After the Dressrosa Arc, it was increased to 130,000,000. Following the Raid on Onigashima, her bounty was increased to 930,000,000.

characters.name: Buchi
characters.short_bio: Buchi is an officer of the Black Cat Pirates. Along with his partner Sham, he is also the protector of the crew's ship, the Bezan Black, and together they are known as the . Due to his actions, he is a supporting antagonist during the Syrup Village Arc.

characters.name: Chiken
characters.short_bio: Chicken is the wife of Gyoru and a fishmonger of Foosha Village.

characters.name: Gonbe
characters.short_bio: Gonbe is known as Chimney's pet cat, although he is actually a rabbit.

characters.name: Onigumo
characters.short_bio: Vice Admiral Onigumo is a Marine officer, and one of the five vice admirals who led the Buster Call on Enies Lobby. His name was revealed in the third databook.

characters.name: Bartholomew Kuma
characters.japanese_name: バーソロミュー・くま
characters.short_bio: Bartholomew Kuma is a former Warlord of the Sea, the former king of the Sorbet Kingdom, and most notably an officer, as well as founding member of the Revolutionary Army with a bounty of 296,000,000. As a pirate, Kuma sailed the seas as a single-person pirate crew. He is also the adoptive father of Jewelry Bonney, daughter of his late friend and fellow revolutionary Ginny. Kuma is a member of the near-extinct special race known as the Buccaneers, inherited from his late father Clapp. Because of the lies told to the public by the World Government, Kuma became feared as an extremely vicious pirate, earning himself the title "Tyrant". In exchange for curing Bonney of the deadly Sapphire Scales disease, Kuma became a special type of cyborg known as a "Pacifista", developed by the world renowned scientist Vegapunk. Once Vegapunk finished his modifications on Kuma, the Warlord was converted into the first complete Pacifista cyborg, with the serial PX-0, and mentally died in the process. Vegapunk also cloned Kuma as S-Bear, one of the Seraphim that were designed to replace the Warlords. Kuma has been enslaved by the World Nobles twice in his lifetime: The first time was in his infancy until he escaped during the God Valley Incident and the second time in adulthood as punishment for the two years he spent protecting the Thousand Sunny, which lasted until his fellow revolutionaries freed him during the most recent Levely. While Kuma was presented as a major antagonist during the Thriller Bark and Sabaody Archipelago Arc, he was secretly an ally. His action of separating the Straw Hat Pirates was ultimately done in their best interest, as it saved them from Admiral Kizaru and helped the crew's captain Monkey D. Luffy realize that his crew was too weak to survive in the New World and needed to train first; thus, Kuma played a key role in the subsequent timeskip. In his mindless state, Kuma is a major antagonist in the Marineford Arc where he took part in the Summit War of Marineford and sided with the Marines, along with most of the other Warlords, but he later becomes a major ally during the Egghead Arc and an important figure behind its ongoings.

characters.name: Carne
characters.short_bio: Carne is one of the main cooks at the Baratie, currently serving as the restaurant's head charcutier.

characters.name: Genbo
characters.short_bio: Genbo is one of the Shandia warriors that fought to take back the Upper Yard from Enel.

characters.name: Wadatsumi
characters.short_bio: "Large Monk" Wadatsumi is a giant tiger blowfish fish-man and a member of the Sun Pirates. He was formerly a member of the Flying Pirates under captain Vander Decken IX before they were defeated. He was a minor antagonist during the Fish-Man Island Arc but became an ally to the Straw Hat Pirates during the Whole Cake Island Arc.

characters.name: Mikazuki
characters.short_bio: Mikazuki is the captain and only named member of the Big Helmet Pirates. He has a bounty of 36,000,000.

characters.name: Page One

devil_fruit.name: Dragon-Dragon Fruit, Model: Spinosaurus
devil_fruit.japanese_name: Ryu Ryu no Mi, Model: Spinosaurus

characters.short_bio: Page One is a former member of the Tobiroppo, the strongest Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates. He is the son of the former Warlord of the Sea Hanafuda and younger brother of fellow former Tobiroppo Ulti. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc. Following the downfall of the Beasts Pirates, Page One and his sister became followers of Yamato after being saved from Who's-Who and became one of his allies in the Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Charlotte Flampé
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・フランペ
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Flampe is the 36th daughter and 77th child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates, serving as the Captain of the Special Attack Unit. She is also Totto Land's Minister of Honey, governing over Rokumitsu Island, and the President of the Katakuri Fan Club. Due to her actions and role, she is a minor antagonist during the Whole Cake Island Arc.

characters.name: Little Oars Jr.
characters.short_bio: Little Oars Jr. (also referred to as Oars III on his flag) is the captain of the Little Pirates, a descendant of Oars, and a former subordinate of the Whitebeard Pirates. He is among the several New World pirates that aided the Whitebeard Pirates in saving Ace from execution by the World Government.

characters.name: Nefertari Cobra
characters.japanese_name: ネフェルタリ・コブラ
characters.short_bio: Nefertari Cobra was the 12th king of the Arabasta Kingdom, the former patriarch of Nefertari Family, husband of the late Nefertari Titi and father of Nefertari Vivi. He was related to Nefertari D. Lili, one of the First Twenty monarchs who founded the World Government, and secretly bore her initial D. in his name. He was a major character throughout the Arabasta Arc and a two-time participant of the Levely, having played a key role in the vote that led to the dissolution of the Seven Warlords of the Sea in the latest one. During the latest Levely, Cobra was murdered by Imu and the Five Elders after learning about the former's existence and sacrificing himself so Sabo could escape.

characters.name: Hyogoro
characters.short_bio: Hyougoro of the Flower is the former yakuza boss of the Flower Capital and the most famous yakuza in Wano Country during the Kouzuki Family's reign. During Kurozumi Orochi's reign, he was imprisoned in Udon's prisoner mines until he was freed by Monkey D. Luffy. As a prisoner, he was known as Grandpa Hyo.

characters.name: Miss Valentine
characters.short_bio: "Courier" Mikita, more commonly known by her alias Miss Valentine, is a former officer agent who was partnered with Mr. 5. As of now, she is currently working as a chocolate lady alongside most of the other Baroque Works members at the new Spiders Cafe. She is one of the main antagonists of the Whisky Peak Arc and a tertiary antagonist of the Little Garden Arc.

characters.name: Charlotte Linlin
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・リンリン
characters.notable_info: Former Emperor, soul manipulation powers, mother of 85 children
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Linlin, better known as "Big Mom", is the captain of the Big Mom Pirates and was formerly one of the Four Emperors ruling over the New World, as the only female member of the group. She is the queen of the archipelago nation Totto Land, a place she seeks to form into a utopia where all the world's races can live together in peace without discrimination or segregation. She is also the matriarch of the Charlotte Family, whose children make up the ministers of her nation and the core infrastructure of her crew. Big Mom wields the Soru Soru no Mi, which allows her to steal the souls of others and implant them in inanimate objects, resulting in the unique race of creatures known as homies, who happily serve her. Big Mom possesses three special homies: the bicorne Napoleon, the sun Prometheus, and the thunder cloud Hera. Hera's position was formerly owned by another thunder cloud, Zeus, but Big Mom grew tired of Zeus' continued failures and created Hera to replace him. In her childhood, Linlin was raised on Elbaph in the Sheep's House under Carmel after being abandoned by her family. After accidentally slaying Jorul, a hero of Elbaph, during one of her hunger pangs, Linlin was relocated to another island. During Linlin's birthday party, as she gorged on sweets, Carmel and her fellow orphans mysteriously disappeared and Linlin inherited Carmel's Devil Fruit. Now alone, she was discovered by Streusen, and the pair co-founded a pirate crew. As a young adult, Big Mom joined the legendary Rocks Pirates, where she formed a bond with apprentice Kaidou. Some time after the God Valley Incident where the Rocks Pirates fell, she formed her own crew once again, the Big Mom Pirates. Big Mom developed an enmity with Monkey D. Luffy and the Straw Hat Pirates, who challenged her ownership of Fish-Man Island and then invaded Whole Cake Island, thwarting her plans to steal technology from the advanced Germa Kingdom during an arranged wedding between Sanji and her daughter, Charlotte Pudding. This grudge brought her to Wano Country in pursuit of Luffy, where she formed an alliance with Kaidou and the Beasts Pirates with the intention of conquering the world and claiming the One Piece. However, this never came to fruition as their alliance would go on to be defeated by the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance that same night. Following her defeat to Eustass Kid and Trafalgar Law, the World Economy News Paper released a new listing of the Four Emperors, with Big Mom no longer being included among them anymore. As a young child at the beginning of her piracy career, Big Mom was assigned a 50,000,000 bounty which was quickly escalated to 500,000,000. By the time of the Raid on Onigashima, at the peak of her piracy career, she held a bounty of 4,388,000,000 which was the second-highest bounty of any living pirate. Big Mom was the last of the Four Emperors to be named; her epithet was first revealed after the Summit War of Marineford by Eustass Kid and her real name was revealed by Pappag on Fish-Man Island. Since the timeskip, she is a minor antagonist during the Fish-Man Island Arc, the main antagonist of the Whole Cake Island Arc and the Whole Cake Island Saga as a whole, and the secondary antagonist of the second half of the Wano Country Arc and Wano Country Saga as a whole.

characters.name: Daisy
characters.short_bio: Daisy is a member of the Kuja Pirates.

characters.name: Bluejam
characters.short_bio: Bluejam was the captain of the Bluejam Pirates, and an infamous pirate of the East Blue. He was the main antagonist of the Post-War Arc during Luffy's flashback sequence.

characters.name: Clione
characters.short_bio: Clione is a member of the Heart Pirates.

characters.name: Ukkari
characters.short_bio: Seaman Recruit Ukkari is a Marine who serves at the Shells Town Marine base.

characters.name: Gambia
characters.short_bio: Gambia the Missionary is the staff officer of the Barto Club. He was also a gladiator competing at the Corrida Colosseum for the Mera Mera no Mi.

characters.name: Bobby Funk
characters.short_bio: Bobby Funk is an assassin from the Mogaro Kingdom and Kelly Funk's younger brother. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.

characters.name: Cocox
characters.short_bio: Cocox is an animal who lives on the Island of Rare Animals. Like all the animals on the island, he is protected by Gaimon. He is classified as a Type B creature, "Small Friendly".

characters.name: Henohenounchi
characters.short_bio: Igaram is the captain of the Arabasta royal guard (captain of Arabasta security in the English dub). He aided Nefertari Vivi in infiltrating Baroque Works as a Frontier Agent and took on the codename Mr. 8. He was partnered with Miss Monday. He is also Terracotta's husband. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Whisky Peak (after being a minor antagonist) and Arabasta Arcs.

characters.name: Road
characters.short_bio: Road is a giant from Elbaph who is the navigator of the New Giant Warrior Pirates and was formerly an S-Class ranked mercenary for Buggy's Delivery. In addition, he rules over a personal diorama full of entrapped humans and giant animals as its "Sun God". He served as a minor antagonist in the beginning of the Elbaph Arc, but later became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates.

characters.name: Superhuman Domingos
characters.short_bio: The Buggy Pirates are a band of pirates led by Buggy, a former Roger Pirates apprentice. Initially an undistinguished (albeit feared) presence in the East Blue, it began pursuing a vendetta after being defeated by the Straw Hat Pirates, and followed them into the Grand Line. Since then, several unlikely circumstances and Buggy's constantly-revolving fortunes have repeatedly overhauled it: first into an alliance with the Alvida Pirates, then into the Seven Warlords-affiliated Buggy's Delivery, and finally into the Four Emperors-affiliated Cross Guild. Due to their actions and role, they serve as the main antagonists of the Orange Town Arc, the protagonists of the Buggy's Crew Adventure Chronicles mini-arc, co-antagonists (alongside Smoker and his Marine unit) in the Loguetown Arc, and side-characters in the Jaya Arc. After the timeskip, they have made tertiary appearances throughout the Dressrosa Arc, the Zou Arc, and the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Kumadori
characters.short_bio: Kumadori is an agent of CP0. Before the time skip, he was an agent of CP9. He is also the son of Kumadori Yamanbako. He was one of the major antagonists during the Enies Lobby Arc.

characters.name: Charlotte Dolce
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・ドルチェ
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Dolce and Dragee (WT100) Charlotte Dolce and Charlotte Dragée are the 45th and 46th sons and the 83rd and 84th children of the Charlotte Family, being the two youngest sons of Charlotte Linlin, and are members of the Big Mom Pirates.

characters.name: Charlotte Dragée
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・ドラジェ
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Dolce and Dragee (WT100) Charlotte Dolce and Charlotte Dragée are the 45th and 46th sons and the 83rd and 84th children of the Charlotte Family, being the two youngest sons of Charlotte Linlin, and are members of the Big Mom Pirates.

characters.name: Jigoro
characters.short_bio: Jigoro of the Wind was a master swordsman who was subsequently revived by Gecko Moria as Zombie #850, a General Zombie. He was animated with Zoro's shadow and eventually assigned to guard Hogback. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Thriller Bark Arc.

characters.name: Pascia
characters.short_bio: Pashia (Funimation) Pascia is a female dancer, who was to be sold at the Auction House.

characters.name: Hamburg
characters.short_bio: Hamburg is a combatant of the Foxy Pirates and the leader of the Groggy Monsters. Alongside Porche, he is one of Foxy's last remaining crewmates. Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the Long Ring Long Land Arc.

characters.name: Jerry
characters.short_bio: Jerry is a Cipher Pol agent of CP6. He was found as head of security of the Puffing Tom's seventh passenger car, which Sanji invaded to rescue Nico Robin. He comes from Karate Island in the South Blue, and claims to be a boxing champion. He was one of the antagonists during the Sea Train voyage in the Water 7 Arc.

characters.name: Oden
characters.affiliation: Kouzuki Family / Roger Pirates / Whitebeard Pirates
characters.short_bio: Kouzuki Oden was the daimyo of Kuri in Wano Country and the son of the former shogun Kouzuki Sukiyaki, being a member of the Kouzuki Family. He was the husband of Kouzuki Toki and the father of Momonosuke and Hiyori. Additionally, he was the leader of a group of legendary and powerful samurai known as the Nine Red Scabbards, with all of them serving as his retainers and most trusted allies. For 5 years of his life, Oden set out to sea and became a pirate, serving as the 2nd division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates and later becoming a member of the Roger Pirates. After finding Joy Boy's treasure on Laugh Tale, Oden journeyed home and made it his goal to open Wano's borders to the world by finally taking his father's place as shogun. However, he met opposition from his usurper Kurozumi Orochi and the pirate Kaidou, who executed him 20 years before the present, in an event known as the Legendary Hour. Oden's name was first mentioned during the Zou Arc. He is the posthumous overarching protagonist of the Wano Country Arc, being the protagonist of a series of events taking place in and outside Wano in the past.

characters.name: Makino
characters.short_bio: Makino is a bartender from Monkey D. Luffy's home town, Foosha Village. She is the owner of Partys Bar and the mother of an unknown child.

characters.name: Enishida
characters.short_bio: Enishida is a member of the Kuja and one of Boa Hancock's attendants in her castle. She is a lady's maid.

characters.name: Mr. Beans
characters.short_bio: Mr. Beans is a former Baroque Works Millions agent who was stationed at Whisky Peak alongside his partner, Miss Catherina. He worked under the Frontier Agents Mr. 8, Miss Monday, Mr. 9 and Miss Wednesday.

characters.name: Gerd
characters.short_bio: Gerd is a giant from Elbaph and the doctor of the New Giant Warrior Pirates. She was formerly an S-Class ranked mercenary for Buggy's Delivery. She is a major ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Elbaph Arc.

characters.name: Tightrope Walking Funan Bros.
characters.japanese_name: 綱渡りフナンボローズ

characters.name: Raizou
characters.short_bio: Raizo of the Mist is a ninja from Wano Country and one of the Nine Red Scabbards who served as Kouzuki Oden's retainers. He was born 55 years ago, but traveled 20 years forward in time at the age of 35. Following Kouzuki Momonosuke's ascent to shogun, he serves as the daimyo of Udon. He acts as a major ally to the Straw Hat Pirates during the Zou and Wano Country Arcs.

characters.name: Charlotte Joscarpone
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・ジョスカルポーネ
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Joscarpone is the 29th daughter and 63rd child of the Charlotte Family, the younger twin sister of Charlotte Mascarpone, and a Snakeneck-human hybrid. She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.

characters.name: Charlotte Mascarpone
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・マスカルポーネ
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Mascarpone is the 34th son and 62nd child of the Charlotte Family, the older twin brother of Joscarpone, and a Snakeneck-human hybrid. He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Tableware, governing over Cutlery Island.

characters.name: Charlotte Angel
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・アンジェル
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Angel is the seventh daughter and 17th child of the Charlotte Family and the younger triplet sister of Cracker and Custard. She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.

characters.name: Charlotte Cracker
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・クラッカー
characters.short_bio: "Thousand Arms" Charlotte Cracker is the tenth son and 15th child of the Charlotte Family and the oldest triplet brother of Custard and Angel. He is also one of the Three Sweet Commanders of the Big Mom Pirates and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Biscuits, governing Biscuits Island. Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the first half of the Whole Cake Island Arc.

characters.name: Charlotte Custard
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・カスタード
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Custard is the sixth daughter and 16th child of the Charlotte Family and the middle triplet sister of Cracker and Angel. She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.

characters.name: Kazekage
characters.short_bio: Kazekage is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates. He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi. Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Woop Slap
characters.short_bio: Woop Slap is the mayor of Monkey D. Luffy's hometown, Foosha Village.

characters.name: Pandaman
characters.short_bio: Pandaman is a joke character created by Eiichiro Oda, and one of the most prominent easter eggs in One Piece. Originally designed for a Kinnikuman character creation contest, Pandaman has gone on to make cameo appearances in many manga chapters, anime episodes, films, and more. He is particularly prominent in several of the video games, even being playable in the first Grand Battle! and its immediate sequel. Due to his status as a joke character, most if not all concrete data on Pandaman has been revealed through the SBS, and may or may not be serious on Oda's part.

characters.name: Minorhinoceros
characters.short_bio: Minorhinoceros is one of the five Jailer Beasts of Impel Down. He is an "awakened" Zoan Devil Fruit user, having eaten a Devil Fruit that allows him to turn into a blue rhinoceros. Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Impel Down Arc.

characters.name: Sanji
characters.short_bio: "Black Leg" Sanji is the cook of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. He is the fifth member of the crew and the fourth to join, doing so at the end of the Baratie Arc. Born as Vinsmoke Sanji, the third son and fourth child of the Vinsmoke Family (thus, making him a former prince of the Germa Kingdom), he disowned his family twice, once in his youth and again after reuniting with them as an adult. After fleeing the Vinsmokes as a child, he eventually entered the care of Zeff as the sous chef of the Baratie, where he would remain until he met Luffy, who convinced him to join his crew. His dream is to find the rumored chef's paradise, the All Blue, which is where the East Blue, West Blue, North Blue, and South Blue meet, along with their wildlife. He is one of the top three fighters of the Straw Hats, alongside Luffy and Zoro, who is referred to as the "Monster Trio". He first gained a bounty of 77,000,000 for his role in the raid on Enies Lobby. It increased to 177,000,000 after the Dressrosa Arc, but the condition of his bounty was changed to Only Alive due to his biological father's interference. After he escaped from Big Mom's territory, his bounty condition was reverted to Dead or Alive (with the Vinsmoke name despite his renouncing it), and its value increased to 330,000,000. Following the Raid on Onigashima, his bounty was increased to 1,032,000,000.

characters.name: Sanjuan Wolf
characters.short_bio: Sanjuan Wolf is an enormous giant, known as "Colossal Battleship" for his size, and and one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates, serving as the captain of the seventh ship of the fleet. . He was one of the legendary criminals imprisoned within the sixth level of the great underwater prison Impel Down until he was freed and recruited by Marshall D. Teach. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Marineford Arc, a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

characters.name: Vinsmoke Ichiji
characters.japanese_name: ヴィンスモーク・イチジ
characters.short_bio: Vinsmoke Ichiji, also known as "Sparking Red", is the eldest son and second child of the Vinsmoke Family. He is a prince of the Germa Kingdom and a commander in its military arm, Germa 66. Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the first half of the Whole Cake Island Arc. However, he and his family became allies of the Straw Hat Pirates and the Fire Tank Pirates after realizing Big Mom deceived and intended to assassinate them. He is also one of the central characters in Germa 66's Ahh... An Emotionless Excursion Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Vinsmoke Niji
characters.japanese_name: ヴィンスモーク・ニジ
characters.short_bio: Vinsmoke Niji, also known as "Dengeki Blue", is the second son and third child of the Vinsmoke Family. He is a prince of the Germa Kingdom and a commander in its military arm, Germa 66. Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the first half of the Whole Cake Island Arc. However, he and his family became allies of the Straw Hat Pirates and the Fire Tank Pirates after realizing Big Mom deceived and intended to assassinate them. He is also one of the central characters in Germa 66's Ahh... An Emotionless Excursion Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Vinsmoke Yonji
characters.japanese_name: ヴィンスモーク・ヨンジ
characters.short_bio: Vinsmoke Yonji, also known as "Winch Green", is the fourth son and youngest child of the Vinsmoke Family. He is a prince of the Germa Kingdom and a commander in its military arm, Germa 66. Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the first half of the Whole Cake Island Arc. However, he and his family became allies of the Straw Hat Pirates and the Fire Tank Pirates after realizing Big Mom deceived and intended to assassinate them. He is also one of the central characters in Germa 66's Ahh... An Emotionless Excursion Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Galdino
characters.short_bio: "Loan Shark" Galdino, alias Mr. 3, is a former officer agent of Baroque Works, partnered with "Miss Goldenweek" Marianne. After being sent to Impel Down, he assisted Buggy and Monkey D. Luffy during their prison breakout and the Summit War of Marineford. When the war ended, he became a member of the Buggy Pirates. After Buggy became a Warlord of the Sea, the Buggy and Alvida Alliance evolved into the Underworld organization known as Buggy's Delivery. The organization was integrated into a larger one, Cross Guild, of which he is currently a member. He is the main antagonist of the Little Garden Arc and a supporting antagonist of the Arabasta Saga as a whole, one of the central characters of the Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works" cover arc (along with the rest of Baroque Works' Officer Agents), and a supporting ally during the Impel Down and Marineford Arcs.

characters.name: Hina
characters.short_bio: "Black Cage" Hina is a Marine Rear Admiral and a former classmate of Vice Admiral Smoker. She currently leads the Black Cage Corps, a unit (containing Jango and Fullbody among others) tasked with patrolling the seas around the Arabasta Kingdom. Originally introduced as a captain, she was promoted to the rank of rear admiral some time after the Summit War of Marineford.

characters.name: O-Tama
characters.short_bio: Kurozumi Tama, commonly known as O-Tama, is a girl from the region of Kuri in Wano Country. She is a kasa weaver working under Tenguyama Hitetsu, as well as a kunoichi in training under the apprenticeship of Shinobu. She is the last known survivor of the Kurozumi Family. Tama befriended Portgas D. Ace four years ago, having wished to join his crew at the time. She is a major ally of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance during the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Masira
characters.short_bio: "Salvage King" Masira is the of the Masira Pirates and the head of a simian ship salvage operation near Jaya Island. His sworn brother is Shoujou and both of them are members of the Saruyama Alliance, headed by Mont Blanc Cricket. He and Shoujou are both fans of Mont Blanc Noland's exploits and the fairy tale book based on them. He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Jaya Arc.

characters.name: Minotaurus
characters.short_bio: Minotaurus is one of the five Jailer Beasts in Impel Down and the first one to appear. He is an "awakened" Zoan Devil Fruit user who ate a fruit that allows him to turn into a Holstein cow. Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Impel Down Arc.

characters.name: Minokoala
characters.short_bio: Minokoala is one of the five Jailer Beasts of Impel Down. He is an "awakened" Zoan Devil Fruit user that ate a fruit that allows him to turn into a koala. Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Impel Down Arc.

characters.name: Sadi
characters.short_bio: Sadi is a chief guard of Impel Down. She always wants to be addressed as Little Sadi. Due to her actions, she is a major antagonist in the Impel Down Arc.

characters.name: Charlotte Brûlée
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・ブリュレ
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Brûlée is the eighth daughter and 19th child of the Charlotte Family and the older twin sister of Broyé. She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. She was stationed in the Seducing Woods to ambush the Sanji Retrieval Team, but after being defeated, the team used her Devil Fruit ability to enter an alternate dimension known as Mirro-World to move around Totto Land. Due to her actions and role, she is a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc. She, alongside her siblings Charlotte Katakuri and Charlotte Oven, become temporary and reluctant allies of the Straw Hat Pirates during One Piece Film: Red.

characters.name: Jaguar D. Saul
characters.japanese_name: ハグワール・D・サウロ
characters.short_bio: Jaguar D. Saul is a giant and former Vice Admiral who deserted the Marines and happened to wash ashore on Ohara. During the Buster Call that destroyed Ohara 22 years ago, he risked his life to protect a young Nico Robin and ended up frozen by fellow former Vice Admiral Kuzan. While Robin and the World Government presumed that he had died, he had actually survived. After collecting the books that Ohara's scholars sacrificed themselves to save, he brought them to Elbaph and went into hiding, after which he stayed and became a history teacher for the Walrus School, located on Elbaph's "Sun World" level. He is a major ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Elbaph Arc.

characters.name: Salome
characters.short_bio: Salome is Boa Hancock’s personal Snake Weapon.

characters.name: Gyoru
characters.short_bio: Gyoru is a fishmonger in Foosha Village and the husband of Chicken. Luffy bought fish from him when he was a kid.

characters.name: Minozebra
characters.short_bio: Minozebra is one of the five Jailer Beasts of Impel Down. He is an "awakened" Zoan Devil Fruit user that ate a fruit that allows him to turn into a zebra. Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Impel Down Arc.

characters.name: Zambai
characters.short_bio: Zambai is a ship dismantler from Water 7, who was a member of the Franky Family and Franky's right hand man. After the timeskip, he, Kiev, and Tamagon have joined the Galley-La Company as Zambai's Company Union. He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 Arc and the beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc, having started off as a minor antagonist in the former.

characters.name: Dracule Mihawk
characters.japanese_name: ジュラキュール・ミホーク
characters.notable_info: World's Greatest Swordsman, former Warlord, wields Yoru
characters.short_bio: Dracule "Hawk Eyes" Mihawk is a world-famous pirate currently recognized as the strongest swordsman in the world. Known as the "Marine Hunter" in his early career, Mihawk stood as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea (the first to be revealed and formally introduced) until the group's dissolution, and was for a time the sole human resident of Kuraigana Island. Since then, he has become a founding executive of the Cross Guild, alongside fellow ex-Warlord Crocodile. Mihawk once led a renowned rivalry with Shanks, currently one of the Four Emperors. In turn, he is viewed as the ultimate opponent by Roronoa Zoro, who pursues his own dream of becoming the world's strongest swordsman. Though Mihawk easily won their first encounter, he grew to respect Zoro, and agreed to mentor him in further swordsmanship during the timeskip. Like the other ex-Warlords, Mihawk has been cloned by Dr. Vegapunk to create one of the Seraphim, S-Hawk, as part of a project to replace the Warlord system. Due to his actions and role, Mihawk can be considered a supporting antagonist in the Baratie Arc and one of the major antagonists in the Marineford Arc, where he took part in the Summit War of Marineford on the side of the Marines, along with most of the other Warlords of the Sea.

characters.name: Franky
characters.notable_info: Cyborg shipwright, built the Thousand Sunny, cola-powered
characters.short_bio: "Iron Man" Franky is the shipwright of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. He is the crew's eighth member and the seventh to join, doing so at the end of the Post-Enies Lobby Arc. Franky was born in the South Blue to Scien, an infamous scientist and pirate who would later be known as Queen of the Beasts Pirates. After his parents abandoned him as a 10-year-old, he eventually made his way to Water 7. Born "Cutty Flam", he chose to go by his nickname of "Franky" until he eventually permanently discarded his true name per the request of Iceburg to hide his identity. He worked as a shipwright of Tom's Workers until, during a failed attempt to save his mentor Tom from the World Government, his body was heavily damaged, requiring him to augment himself into a cyborg. Upon returning to Water 7, he became the leader of the Franky Family, a group of ship dismantlers and bounty hunters. Franky and his followers were introduced as the secondary antagonists of the Water 7 Arc, until circumstances forced them to become allies at the end of the same arc and the Enies Lobby Arc. Franky's dream is to create a ship and circumnavigate the world with it, and he built the Thousand Sunny and joined the Straw Hat Pirates to fulfill his dream. He gained a bounty of 44,000,000 for his involvement at the Enies Lobby Incident. It later increased to 94,000,000 after the Dressrosa Arc. Following the Raid on Onigashima, his bounty was increased to 394,000,000.

characters.name: Shanks
characters.notable_info: Emperor, inspired Luffy, powerful Haki user
characters.short_bio: "Red-Haired" Shanks, commonly known as just "Red Hair", is the chief of the Red Hair Pirates and one of the Four Emperors that rule over the New World. Born in God Valley to the Figarland Family of the World Nobles, Shanks is the son of Figarland Garling and the younger twin brother of Shamrock. However, as an infant during the God Valley Incident, Shanks was bequeathed to Monkey D. Dragon by his mother. He ended up in a treasure chest which was stolen by the Roger Pirates, resulting in him being adopted and raised onboard the Oro Jackson. He served on Gol D. Roger's crew as an apprentice alongside Buggy. After Roger's death, Shanks began to assemble his own crew, only to then return to Mary Geoise to reunite with his family and join the Knights of God, becoming Saint Shanks. However, Shanks ultimately abdicated his noble status after working against Mary Geoise; he then rapidly attained infamy as a pirate before being named as one of the Emperors six years ago. Shanks is a major figure in Monkey D. Luffy's life, having saved his life as a child twelve years ago and inspiring Luffy to set his own path as a pirate to surpass him someday. He gave Luffy the straw hat that Roger once wore, as a symbol of their promise to meet again once Luffy had surpassed him, and also accidentally enabled Luffy to eat the Gomu Gomu no Mi. Two years ago, Shanks was pivotal in bringing the Summit War of Marineford to a close. Following the downfall of his rival Emperors in Wano Country, Shanks has set his sights on claiming the One Piece. Shanks has been an important background character throughout the series, usually being shown acknowledging Luffy's ever-growing reputation as a pirate. He serves as a minor ally to Luffy during both the Marineford and Wano Country Arcs. He and his crew also have a sizable role in One Piece Film: Red, which centers on Uta, Shanks' adopted daughter.

characters.name: Hotori
characters.short_bio: Hotori and Kotori are the younger brothers of Satori. They are lieutenants of the Divine Soldiers, an army of 50 warriors under the command of Yama, their leader, and Enel. They are minor antagonists during the Skypiea Arc.

characters.name: Kotori
characters.short_bio: Hotori and Kotori are the younger brothers of Satori. They are lieutenants of the Divine Soldiers, an army of 50 warriors under the command of Yama, their leader, and Enel. They are minor antagonists during the Skypiea Arc.

characters.name: Nola
characters.short_bio: Nola, known to many as the Master of the Sky, is a giant snake who lives on Upper Yard in Skypiea. Having lived for over four centuries, the snake was once the companion of Kalgara and Mont Blanc Noland back when Upper Yard was still part of Jaya. It is the grandchild of the snake Kashigami, whom the Shandia once worshiped as a god.

characters.name: Satori
characters.short_bio: Satori of the Forest is one of four former priests of Enel's God's Army, operating the Ordeal of Balls to punish criminals during Enel's reign. He is also the oldest triplet brother of Hotori and Kotori. Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist of the Skypiea Arc.

characters.name: Sentomaru
characters.short_bio: Sentomaru is a former Marine Officer and the former captain of the Marines' Science Unit, as well as Dr. Vegapunk's former bodyguard. He turned against the World Government and the Marines by siding with Vegapunk and the Straw Hat Pirates during the Egghead Incident. Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist in the Sabaody Archipelago Arc and the secondary antagonist of the Return to Sabaody Arc. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates in the Egghead Arc.

characters.name: Spandam
characters.short_bio: Spandam is the former chief of CP9 and CP5. He is the son of Spandine, who was also his predecessor as the chief of CP9. He currently serves under CP0. He planned to obtain the blueprints for Pluton and bring Nico Robin to justice. Ten years ago, he framed Tom's Workers for a bombing attack on Water 7, which caused Tom to take responsibility and be executed. As revenge, Franky disfigured his face. He is the main antagonist of the Water 7 Saga, appearing as the overarching antagonist of the Water 7 Arc and the main antagonist of the Enies Lobby Arc. He also appears as a minor antagonist in One Piece Film: Gold.

characters.name: Patty
characters.short_bio: Patty is one of the main cooks at the Baratie, currently serving as the restaurant's head pâtissier.

characters.name: Sarutobi
characters.short_bio: Sarutobi is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates. He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi. Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Lafitte
characters.short_bio: Laffitte, nicknamed "Demon Sheriff", is the navigator and one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates, serving as the captain of the fifth ship of the fleet. He is also a former West Blue policeman known for countless acts of police brutality, which resulted in his exile from that sea. Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Jaya Arc, a supporting antagonist in the Impel Down and Marineford Arcs, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

characters.name: Alvida
characters.short_bio: "Iron Mace" Alvida is the former captain of the Alvida Pirates, and the first enemy pirate Monkey D. Luffy encountered in his own pirate career. After her defeat by Luffy, she met and allied with Buggy to form the Buggy and Alvida Alliance, and for a time became the acting captain during Buggy's entanglements in Impel Down and the Summit War of Marineford. Since then, she has remained with the crew throughout Buggy's revolving fortunes, occupying high positions in both Buggy's Delivery and the Cross Guild. Due to her actions, she can be regarded as the secondary antagonist of the Romance Dawn Arc and a tertiary antagonist in the Loguetown Arc.

characters.name: Charlotte Perospero
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・ペロスペロー
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Perospero is the eldest child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Candy, governing over Candy Island. Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc and a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Smoker
characters.notable_info: Marine Vice Admiral, persistent pursuer of Luffy
characters.short_bio: Smoker the White Hunter is a Marine vice-admiral and the commander of G-5 Branch's Unit 01, as well as the overall Base Commander of the G-5 Marine base. Originally a ranking captain in Loguetown, Smoker became fixated on Monkey D. Luffy's Straw Hat Pirates for escaping his previously-unbroken authority, and—with his loyal subordinate Tashigi—quit his post to pursue them into the Grand Line. Since then, he has battled the Straw Hats repeatedly, in addition to many larger threats that won him new recognition and promotion through the Marine Ranks. One of Luffy's longest-recurring adversaries, Smoker can be considered the main antagonist of the Loguetown Arc, and a minor antagonist during the Marineford Arc. Though playing a similar role initially, he becomes a temporary ally during the Arabasta Arc and Punk Hazard Arc.

characters.name: Who's-Who

devil_fruit.name: Cat-Cat Fruit, Model: Saber Tiger
devil_fruit.japanese_name: Neko Neko no Mi, Model: Saber Tiger

characters.short_bio: '''Who's-Who, also known as Who of the Droplets''', is a pirate who acted as one of the Tobiroppo, the strongest six Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates, prior to Kaidou's fall from power after the Raid on Onigashima. Over a decade ago, he served as an agent of CP9 before his failure to guard the Gomu Gomu no Mi led to his dismissal from service and imprisonment. Upon escaping, Who's-Who turned to piracy, becoming captain of the Who's-Who Pirates before eventually joining the Beasts Pirates. Due to his actions and role, Who's-Who is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc and the Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage cover story.

characters.name: Tom
characters.short_bio: Tom was a long-horned cowfish fish-man known as the greatest shipwright in the world, particularly for building the Roger Pirates' ship, the Oro Jackson. He was also the older brother of Den, a fellow fish-man shipwright. As the head of Tom's Workers, Tom was pivotal to the redevelopment of Water 7, directly mentoring both Iceburg and Franky and laying groundwork for what would become the Galley-La Company. His ultimate innovation, the Sea Train, impressed even the World Government into pardoning his associations with Pirate King Gol D. Roger. However, in order to protect his apprentices from a frame-up orchestrated by CP5's Spandam, Tom renounced this pardon and was taken to Enies Lobby, presumably to be executed shortly after.

characters.name: Ideaman
characters.short_bio: Ideaman is a member of Krieg Pirates. He is the Staff Officer of Planning.

characters.name: Trebol
characters.short_bio: Sticky-Sticky Fruit (FUNimation) Trebol is one of the top three officers of the Donquixote Pirates, acting as a Staff Officer. He occupies the Club seat of the Donquixote Family and is the leader of the crew's Trebol Army subdivision. He is also personally responsible for fostering Donquixote Doflamingo's cruelty from a young age, making him the indirect cause of an inhumanly large amount of evil and suffering brought about by Doflamingo's wrath. Because of this, he can be considered a tertiary antagonist in the Dressrosa Arc with a greater influence and impact than what is first suggested in his initial appearances.

characters.name: Atmos
characters.short_bio: "Water Buffalo" Atmos is the former 13th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.

characters.name: Scratchmen Apoo
characters.japanese_name: スクラッチメン・アプー
characters.short_bio: Scratchmen Apoo, also known as "Roar of the Sea", is the captain of the On Air Pirates and was formerly an informant for the Beasts Pirates, led by Kaidou of the Four Emperors. He is a member of the Longarm Tribe and one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation", being one of the eleven Supernovas who came to Sabaody Archipelago two years ago with a bounty of 198,000,000. Two years later, his bounty increased to 350,000,000. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Sabo
characters.notable_info: Luffy's sworn brother, inherited Ace's Devil Fruit
characters.short_bio: "Flame Emperor" Sabo is the Revolutionary Army's chief of staff, recognized as the No. 2 of the entire organization under Supreme Commander Monkey D. Dragon. He is also the sworn brother of the notorious pirates Monkey D. Luffy and the late Portgas D. Ace. Raised in nobility by his parents Outlook III and Didit in the Goa Kingdom, Sabo ran away and met Ace and Luffy while living as a vagabond in Gray Terminal. He tried to set sail just a few months afterward to get away from his family, but had his ship destroyed by the World Noble Saint Jalmack. He was saved by Dragon but lost his memory in the process, and so devoted his life to the service of the Revolutionary Army. However, his memories would return 10 years later after hearing about Ace's death.
