characters.short_bio: Vinsmoke Sora was the queen of the Germa Kingdom, the wife of Vinsmoke Judge and the mother of Vinsmoke Reiju, Vinsmoke Ichiji, Vinsmoke Niji, Sanji and Vinsmoke Yonji who died sometime during Sanji's childhood.

characters.name: Kamakiri
characters.short_bio: Kamakiri is one of the Shandia warriors that fought to take Upper Yard from Enel. After the timeskip, he joined the God's Guards under Wyper.

characters.name: Ramba
characters.short_bio: Ramba is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied with Whitebeard.

characters.name: Blue Fan
characters.short_bio: Blue Fan is a member of the Kuja Pirates.

characters.name: Pearl
characters.short_bio: Pearl the Iron Wall is the commander of the Krieg Pirates' second unit. Due to his actions, he can be considered the tertiary antagonist of the Baratie Arc.

characters.name: Sarquiss
characters.short_bio: "Big Knife" Sarquiss is the former first mate of the Bellamy Pirates, with a bounty of 38,000,000 on his head. His epithet originates from the large dagger he always wields, which bears a strong resemblance to a massive kukri. Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Jaya Arc.

characters.name: Acrobatic Fuwas
characters.japanese_name: アクロバティック・フワーズ
characters.short_bio: The Buggy Pirates are a band of pirates led by Buggy, a former Roger Pirates apprentice. Initially an undistinguished (albeit feared) presence in the East Blue, it began pursuing a vendetta after being defeated by the Straw Hat Pirates, and followed them into the Grand Line. Since then, several unlikely circumstances and Buggy's constantly-revolving fortunes have repeatedly overhauled it: first into an alliance with the Alvida Pirates, then into the Seven Warlords-affiliated Buggy's Delivery, and finally into the Four Emperors-affiliated Cross Guild. Due to their actions and role, they serve as the main antagonists of the Orange Town Arc, the protagonists of the Buggy's Crew Adventure Chronicles mini-arc, co-antagonists (alongside Smoker and his Marine unit) in the Loguetown Arc, and side-characters in the Jaya Arc. After the timeskip, they have made tertiary appearances throughout the Dressrosa Arc, the Zou Arc, and the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: King Baum
characters.short_bio: Kingbaum is a tree homie, a member of the Big Mom Pirates, and the master of the Seducing Woods on Whole Cake Island. However, he was forced to serve the Straw Hat Pirates due to them possessing Charlotte Linlin's Vivre Card.

characters.name: Queen

devil_fruit.name: Dragon-Dragon Fruit, Model: Brachiosaurus
devil_fruit.japanese_name: Ryu Ryu no Mi, Model: Brachiosaurus

characters.short_bio: Queen the Plague is an All-Star of the Beasts Pirates as one of Kaidou's three closest confidants. He was formerly the ruler of the Udon region in Wano Country. Born as Scien, he previously was also part of the rogue scientific research team MADS before joining Kaidou. During his time with MADS, Queen fathered a son named Cutty Flam but abandoned him 26 years ago, which started the chain of events that would cause his son to go on to become Franky of the Straw Hat Pirates. Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Bastille
characters.short_bio: "Shark Cutter" Bastille is a Marine Vice Admiral who took part in the Summit War of Marineford. He later appeared in Dressrosa under the command of Admiral Fujitora. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Morgans

devil_fruit.name: Bird-Bird Fruit, Model: Albatross
devil_fruit.japanese_name: Tori Tori no Mi, Model: Albatross

characters.short_bio: "Big News" Morgans is the president of the World Economy News Paper and one of the emperors of the Underworld. His first appearance was during the Whole Cake Island Arc, as one of the more high-profile guests in Big Mom's Tea Party. Since then, Morgans has been a frequent figure in the world's ongoings, usually by being the first to report on them to the general public.

characters.name: Donquixote Rosinante
characters.japanese_name: ドンキホーテ・ロシナンテ
characters.short_bio: Donquixote Rosinante was a former World Noble of the Donquixote Family descent, being the second son of Donquixote Homing and the younger brother of Donquixote Doflamingo. After his family lost their status as Celestial Dragons and became pariahs, Rosinante was discovered by Sengoku and enlisted into the Marines, eventually reaching the rank of Commander. Upon reuniting with Doflamingo, he feigned muteness and operated as an Elite Officer of the Donquixote Pirates, serving Doflamingo under the codename Corazon while remaining an undercover Marine. Rosinante abandoned his post in an attempt to cure Trafalgar D. Water Law of his Amber Lead Syndrome. He eventually obtained the Ope Ope no Mi, forcing Law to eat it and thus giving him the means to save himself from the disease. However, his cover was blown by the former Corazon, Vergo, and he was subsequently executed by Doflamingo. Rosinante's kindness and sacrifice would serve as driving motivators for Law to one day avenge him by defeating Doflamingo.

characters.name: Helmeppo
characters.notable_info: Marine officer, Coby's friend, son of Captain Morgan
characters.short_bio: Lieutenant Commander Helmeppo is a Marine officer and the son of ex-Marine Captain "Axe-Hand" Morgan. Once a civilian who shamelessly exploited his father's status, he (together with Koby) underwent extensive training under Vice Admiral Garp to become a full-fledged serviceman, currently holding the rank of lieutenant commander. He is also a member of the secret group known as SWORD. Due to his actions during his initial appearance, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Romance Dawn Arc. He and Koby are also the protagonists of Diary of Koby-Meppo Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Seto
characters.short_bio: Seto was one of the Shandia who lived on Jaya four hundred years ago. He was the husband of Kalgara's daughter Mousse, making him an ancestor to Wyper.

characters.name: Hammond
characters.short_bio: Hammond is a member of the New Fish-Man Pirates. He is a [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daggertooth_pike_conger Daggertooth pike conger] Fish-Man. He serves as a supporting antagonist in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

characters.name: Hoichael
characters.short_bio: Michael and Hoichael are two troublemaker children in the backstreets of Water 7. They idolize Franky, and even dress like him and use his motto as their own: "Mm, super!!", and similarly idolize Paulie. However, their backstreet delinquency has earned them ire from at least Tilestone and Peepley Lulu. Before the timeskip, they were part of class 6-5 of the Water 7 Back Alley Elementary School backstreet elementary school.

characters.name: Michael
characters.short_bio: Michael and Hoichael are two troublemaker children in the backstreets of Water 7. They idolize Franky, and even dress like him and use his motto as their own: "Mm, super!!", and similarly idolize Paulie. However, their backstreet delinquency has earned them ire from at least Tilestone and Peepley Lulu. Before the timeskip, they were part of class 6-5 of the Water 7 Back Alley Elementary School backstreet elementary school.

characters.name: Nugire Yainu
characters.short_bio: Nugire Yainu was the shipwright of the Black Cat Pirates and the crew member who was killed by the Marines three years prior to Kuro enacting his plan.

characters.name: Smiley

devil_fruit.name: Salamander-Salamander Fruit, Model: Axolotl
devil_fruit.japanese_name: Sara Sara no Mi, Model: Axolotl

characters.short_bio: Smiley, more commonly known as Slime, was a pet of Caesar Clown. It was created by gathering and compressing the poisonous H2S gas that had spread throughout Punk Hazard and using Vegapunk's process of Zoan Devil Fruit animation to bring it to life. It was kept in the Burning Lands before being released.

characters.name: Wire
characters.short_bio: Wire is a member of the Kid Pirates.

characters.name: Prometheus
characters.short_bio: Prometheus the Sun is a sun homie that Big Mom summons from her right hand. He is a special kind of homie, as he received a soul fragment from Big Mom herself, and serves as one of her personal weapons alongside Napoleon and Hera, and formerly Zeus.

characters.name: Yu
characters.short_bio: Yu is a little girl who accidentally bumped into Smoker and got ice cream on his uniform.

characters.name: Chess
characters.short_bio: Chess is a former minister of defense serving under Wapol. After the attack of Blackbeard, he became a pirate alongside his king, until their subsequent return to Drum Island. Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Drum Island Arc.

characters.name: Giovanni
characters.short_bio: Giovanni is a zebra mink and one of the Three Inuarashi Musketeers leading the squad.

characters.name: Ham Burger
characters.short_bio: Ham Burger is the king of the Ballywood Kingdom, acting as chairman of the most recent Levely.

characters.name: Pansy
characters.short_bio: Pansy is a member of the Kuja tribe.

characters.name: Kanjuro
characters.short_bio: Kurozumi Kanjuro, nicknamed "Evening Shower" Kanjuro, was a samurai from the Kuri region of Wano Country and a member of the Kurozumi Family. After losing his parents, he was instructed by Kurozumi Orochi to operate undercover within the Kouzuki Family. Kanjuro became Kouzuki Oden's retainer and one of the Nine Red Scabbards while secretly aiding Orochi in his rise to power and efforts to eliminate the Kouzuki bloodline, by feeding him information. He would continue to do so until he revealed himself as Orochi's spy just before the Raid on Onigashima, leading to his former comrades engaging in battle with him until he was lethally wounded by Kin'emon during a final skirmish, dubbing it his final act. He was born 54 years before the present day, but traveled 20 years forward in time when he was 34 years old. He acted as an ally to the Straw Hat Pirates in his undercover role during the Dressrosa Arc and Zou Arc, but was revealed to be a major antagonist of the Wano Country Arc during its third act.

characters.name: Charlotte Praline
characters.japanese_name: シャーロット・プラリネ
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Praline is a half-human and half-hammerhead shark mermaid, the 21st daughter and 47th child of the Charlotte Family, and the younger twin sister of Prim. She was also Totto Land's former Minister of Design, having governed over Unique Island until her defection. She married Aladine sometime in the past two years, and became a member of his crew, the Sun Pirates, cutting off ties with her family and working against them in the process.

characters.name: Charlotte Prim
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Prim is the 20th daughter and 46th child of the Charlotte Family, the older twin sister of Praline, and an octopus mermaid-human hybrid. She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates. She was also a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.

characters.name: Richie
characters.short_bio: Richie is Mohji's pet lion, and a recurring member of the Buggy Pirates in all their various incarnations. He is classified as a Type C creature, "Big Savage". He serves as a supporting antagonist during the Orange Town Arc.

characters.name: Leo
characters.short_bio: "Warrior" Leo is a dwarf from the Tontatta Kingdom and the leader of the "Tonta Corps ", which was later reformed as a pirate crew now known as the Tontatta Pirates, with Leo now acting as the captain. He is the captain of the fifth ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Dressrosa Arc, and one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Nojiko
characters.short_bio: Nojiko is the owner of a mikan farm in Cocoyasi Village and the adoptive older sister of Nami. They were raised together by their adoptive mother, Bell-mère. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Arlong Park Arc.

characters.name: Mr. 5
characters.short_bio: Gem of the Border, better known by his alias Mr. 5, was formerly the lowest-ranked officer agent in Baroque Works along with his partner, Miss Valentine. He now works as a fireman at the new Spiders Cafe alongside most of his former colleagues. He was one of the main antagonists of the Whisky Peak Arc and the tertiary antagonist of the Little Garden Arc.

characters.name: Kikyo
characters.short_bio: Kikyo is a Kuja warrior from Amazon Lily.

characters.name: Thalassa Lucas
characters.short_bio: Thalassa Lucas is the former king of the Ilisia Kingdom, a country in West Blue.

characters.name: Flapper
characters.short_bio: Flapper is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit, when he stopped Leo from taking Robin's clothes and belongings. He participated in Operation SOP and became a temporary victim of Sugar's Hobi Hobi no Mi.

characters.name: Hustle
characters.short_bio: Hustle is a member of the Krieg Pirates and a combat instructor.

characters.name: Kadar
characters.short_bio: Rear Admiral Kadar is a Marine Rear Admiral at the G-2 Marine base from fifteen years ago. His current location and rank are unknown.

characters.name: Miss Doublefinger
characters.short_bio: "Poison Spider" Zala, better known by her alias Miss Doublefinger, was the second highest ranking female officer agent in the secret organization known as Baroque Works. As an officer agent, she was partnered with Mr. 1. She also used the alias of Paula while she acted as the owner of Spiders Cafe in Arabasta. She was a major antagonist during the Arabasta Arc. After the group's dissolution, she went back to being the owner of the New Spiders Cafe alongside most of her Baroque Works colleagues.

characters.name: Aphelandra
characters.short_bio: Aphelandra is a member of the tribe of Kuja living on the island of Amazon Lily. During the timeskip, she became a member of the Kuja Pirates.

characters.name: Bishamon
characters.short_bio: Bishamon is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates. He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi. Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Urouge
characters.short_bio: Urouge, nicknamed the Mad Monk, is a pirate hailing from a sky island and high priest of the Fallen Monk Pirates. He is one of twelve pirates referred to as the "Worst Generation", and prior to the two-year timeskip had a bounty of 108,000,000.

characters.name: Époni
characters.short_bio: Époni is a nurse in service to the royal household of the Germa Kingdom. She was primarily charged with caring for the late queen, Vinsmoke Sora.

characters.name: Yasopp
characters.short_bio: Yasopp, known as "Chaser", is one of the Senior Officers and the sniper of the Red Hair Pirates. He is also the father of Usopp and the widower of Banchina.

characters.name: Hanzo
characters.short_bio: Hanzo is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates. He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi. Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Inazuma
characters.short_bio: Inazuma is a newkama and the deputy commander of the G Army in the Revolutionary Army, serving under Emporio Ivankov as his right hand man/woman.

characters.name: Marshall D. Teach
characters.japanese_name: マーシャル・D・ティーチ
characters.notable_info: Only person with two Devil Fruits, killed Whitebeard
characters.short_bio: Marshall D. Teach, most commonly referred to by his epithet "Blackbeard", is the admiral of the Blackbeard Pirates, and one of the Four Emperors that rule over the New World. He is the son of the infamous pirate Rocks D. Xebec and Eris, making him a member of the nearly extinct Davy Family, thus a descendant of the legendary pirate Davy D. Jones which is only known to a small number of individuals, including his own crew and the Five Elders. He is also the only known person in history to wield the powers of two Devil Fruits. Teach started out his pirate career as an apprentice of the Whitebeard Pirates, then later became a member of the crew's 2nd Division. However, he murdered Thatch, the 4th Division Commander, in order to steal the Yami Yami no Mi, a rare darkness-based Logia Devil Fruit with the power to nullify the Devil Fruit abilities of others. He then fled from Whitebeard's crew and, after defeating the infamous 2nd Division Commander Portgas D. Ace and handing him over to the Marines, was awarded a position among the Seven Warlords of the Sea. He only held the position briefly, though, using it to infiltrate the great underwater prison Impel Down and escaping with multiple infamous Level 6 prisoners recruited into his crew. Upon arriving at the Summit War of Marineford, he resigned from his position and murdered Whitebeard, mysteriously stealing his quake-generating power. This, along with his victory in the Payback War and conquest of the majority of Whitebeard's territories during the timeskip, resulted in his acknowledgement as one of the Four Emperors, as well as him being considered a part of the "Worst Generation" along with the eleven Supernovas. After the Rocky Port Incident, he turned the island of Hachinosu into his base of operations with the ambition of having it officially accepted into the World Government as the Blackbeard Kingdom. Teach initially had no bounty; however, after resigning from the Seven Warlords, recruiting several dangerous criminals to his crew from Impel Down, and becoming one of the Four Emperors, he received a bounty of 2,247,600,000. Following the downfalls of Kaidou and Big Mom during the Wano Country Arc, his bounty was increased to 3,996,000,000 for unknown reasons. Due to his actions throughout the series, namely his key role in the deaths of Portgas D. Ace and Whitebeard, Teach consistently serves as one of the primary antagonists of the entire series. During the series' first half, he is an unseen minor antagonist in the Drum Island Arc, a minor antagonist in the Jaya Arc, the secondary antagonist of the Post-Enies Lobby Arc, and the overarching antagonist of the Summit War Saga. During the series' second half, he is a minor antagonist in the Dressrosa Arc and Wano Country Arc, a supporting antagonist in the Egghead Arc, and one of the overarching main antagonists in the Final Saga.

characters.name: Amazon
characters.short_bio: Amazon was the elderly gatekeeper of Skypiea and informer at the entrance to Skypiea known as Heaven's Gate. She let people in even if they could not pay her extol toll, but purposely failed to tell those who did not pay about the consequences for entering the city. After the timeskip, she became the admission ticket saleswoman for Skypiea's new theme park, Wagomuland.

characters.name: Dirt Boss
characters.short_bio: The Dirt Boss is a giant mole awoken by Gedatsu during his work for Goro in his cover story.

characters.name: Rebecca
characters.short_bio: Rebecca is the daughter of Scarlett and Kyros, the niece of Viola and the granddaughter of Riku Doldo III. She is the former crown princess of Dressrosa, who forfeited her title to live with her father and currently serves as a lady-in-waiting to her aunt, Viola. While living under Donquixote Doflamingo's regime, she was imprisoned and forced to fight as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum. She joined a tournament to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi, winning the D Block and battling in the finals before Sabo claimed the Devil Fruit. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Gaimon
characters.short_bio: Gaimon is a former pirate who currently lives inside a treasure chest on the Island of Rare Animals.

characters.name: Octopako
characters.short_bio: Octopako is an octopus fish-woman whom Hatchan tried to win over during his cover story, Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll.

characters.name: Vasco Shot
characters.short_bio: Vasco Shot, monikered "Heavy Drinker", is one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates, serving as the captain of the eighth ship of the fleet. He was originally one of several legendary criminals given a life sentence on Impel Down's Level 6, before being freed by Marshall D. Teach and joining him. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Marineford Arc, a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

characters.name: Blenheim
characters.short_bio: Blenheim is the former 9th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.

characters.name: Gladius
characters.short_bio: Gladius is an officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Pica Army. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Gomorrah
characters.short_bio: Gomorrah is one of the two gigantic King Bulls owned by the Franky Family, the other being Sodom.

characters.name: Sodom
characters.short_bio: Sodom is one of the two gigantic King Bulls (sea horse in the most literal sense) owned by the Franky Family, the other being Gomorrah.

characters.name: Bellamy
characters.short_bio: Bellamy "the Hyena" is a dyer and retired pirate hailing from the North Blue. Originally captain of the Bellamy Pirates, he was renowned in Mock Town as the "Big-Time Rookie" until his humiliating defeat by Monkey D. Luffy. Desperate to redeem himself to his idol Donquixote Doflamingo, he worked back up as a full-fledged member of the Donquixote Pirates, until the crew was entirely destroyed in Dressrosa by the Straw Hat Pirates. He is the main antagonist of the Jaya Arc, and a minor antagonist in the Dressrosa Arc. He is also given some focus in the The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet cover arc.

characters.name: Kaku

devil_fruit.name: Ox-Ox Fruit, Model: Giraffe
devil_fruit.japanese_name: Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Giraffe

characters.short_bio: Kaku is a masked agent of CP0. He was previously an assassin of CP9, operating undercover in order to obtain the Pluton blueprints from Iceburg. While undercover, he acted as one of the five foremen of Galley-La Company's Dock One, specializing in mechanics, diagnostics, and housecalls. He is a major antagonist in the Water 7 and Enies Lobby Arcs, and a supporting antagonist in the Egghead Arc, later turned reluctant temporary ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the latter Arc.

characters.name: Buggy
characters.notable_info: Former Roger Pirates crew member, current Emperor
characters.short_bio: Buggy the Star Clown is the nominal president of Cross Guild, and one of the current Four Emperors dominating the New World. Initially a Roger Pirates apprentice alongside Shanks, Buggy succeeded his disbanded mentors as a career pirate in the East Blue, in time becoming captain of the Buggy Pirates. One of the earliest enemies defeated by Monkey D. Luffy and the Straw Hat Pirates, revenge drove him to an alliance with "Iron Mace" Alvida and pursuit into the Grand Line. Since then, his fortunes have constantly, dramatically revolved: from imprisonment in Impel Down to entanglement in its first mass-breakout and the subsequent Summit War of Marineford, his escalating infamy won him entry to the Seven Warlords of the Sea, allowing him to launch the pirate mercenary organization Buggy's Delivery. After the Warlords were outlawed, Buggy found himself "leading" the Cross Guild, a successor group actually controlled by fellow ex-Warlords Crocodile and Dracule Mihawk; with his inflated reputation, he was grudgingly retained as figurehead leader, and gained recognition as one of the new Emperors. Emboldened, Buggy has declared his intent to become the Pirate King, putting Cross Guild in pursuit of One Piece. He is the main antagonist of the Orange Town Arc and a secondary antagonist in the Loguetown Arc, as well as the central protagonist of the Buggy's Crew Adventure Chronicles cover arc (the manga's first). Since then, he has become one of the series' most-recurring characters, serving as a supporting character through the Summit War Saga in addition to tertiary appearances in the Jaya Arc, Zou Arc, Wano Country Arc, and Egghead Arc. He is also the main antagonist in most episodes of "Boss Luffy Historical Special". He also serves as a reluctant ally to Luffy in the <s>3D</s>2Y special episode, and the movie One Piece: Stampede.

characters.name: Hatchan
characters.short_bio: Hatchan, nicknamed "Hachi", is an octopus fish-man who was an officer of the Arlong Pirates before their defeat, and a member of the Sun Pirates before that. After the rest of the Arlong Pirates were arrested, Hatchan was the sole member to escape, and went on many adventures which ended in him opening a floating takoyaki restaurant and meeting up again with the Straw Hat Pirates. He was one of the major antagonists of the Arlong Park Arc. He is also the central character of the Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll Cover Page Serial. Later, along with Camie, he is one of the main supporting characters of both the Sabaody Archipelago and Fish-Man Island Arcs as an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates.

characters.name: Yazaemon
characters.short_bio: Yazaemon is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates. He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi. Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Hack
characters.short_bio: "Hundredth Dan" Hack is a Japanese soldierfish fish-man and a member of the Revolutionary Army, which he serves as combat instructor. He went to Dressrosa to investigate the arms trafficking there and competed at the Corrida Colosseum for the Mera Mera no Mi.

characters.name: Vegapunk
characters.short_bio: Dr. Vegapunk was the leading scientist of the SSG in the employment of the Marines. His work included discovering the secrets and uses of seastone, the secrets of how Devil Fruit powers work, the co-discovery of the Lineage Factor and its applications, the creation of the Pacifista and Seraphim, and various other scientific achievements that are said to be at least 500 years ahead of current technology. He hailed from the technologically advanced Karakuri Island and resided on Egghead, where his laboratory is located. Before being employed under the World Government, Vegapunk had been the director of an outlaw scientific research team known as MADS. The team was eventually arrested, and Vegapunk was later integrated into the Marines as its head scientist after MADS' dissolution. During his tenure at Egghead, he created six copies, or "satellites", of himself, each embodying an aspect of his personality. However, once York revealed to the World Government that Vegapunk was researching the Void Century, they dispatched CP0 and conspired with her to eliminate him, which resulted in the monumental Egghead Incident. Vegapunk was killed by his old friend, Admiral Kizaru, during the ensuing Buster Call on Egghead. Foreseeing his assassination, however, Vegapunk left behind an important message to be broadcasted around the world regarding a catastrophic global future event. He was survived by all six of his satellites: most ascended with Punk Records into the clouds, York remained with the World Government, and Lilith escaped with the Straw Hat Pirates and is attempting to resurrect Vegapunk via cloning. First mentioned during the Post-Enies Lobby Arc, Vegapunk was a major background character throughout the series until his proper introduction during the Egghead Arc, becoming a major ally to the Straw Hat Pirates alongside his satellites and playing a central role during its ongoings.

characters.name: Wapol

devil_fruit.name: Munch-Munch Fruit
devil_fruit.power: Eat anything and integrate it into body

characters.short_bio: "Tin-Plate" Wapol is the king of the South Blue's Evil Black Drum Kingdom and chairman of an international toy conglomerate. Originally king of the Grand Line's Drum Island, Wapol fled when the Blackbeard Pirates attacked (spending some time as the "captain" of his own, improvised pirate crew) and was permanently deposed by the Straw Hat Pirates soon after. However, his chance creation of a unique "miracle" alloy allowed him to rebuild as a toy manufacturer, winning wealth and power anew and eventually securing his current kingdom with the world-famous Kinderella as consort. After accidentally witnessing the Five Elders and Imu assassinating King Nefertari Cobra at the latest Levely, he went into hiding aboard "Big News" Morgan's airship alongside Nefertari Vivi. He is the main antagonist of the Drum Island Arc (and by extension the ninth movie). He is also the protagonist of the Wapol's Omnivorous Hurrah cover arc.

characters.name: Fujitora
characters.short_bio: Issho, better known by his alias Fujitora, is an Admiral in the Marines. Once the captain of a guard force in the former Aoi Kingdom, he was conscripted through a World Military Draft during the two-year timeskip, being appointed to fill one of the Admiral vacancies caused by Kuzan's resignation and Sakazuki's promotion alongside his co-worker Ryokugyu. A proponent of "Humane Justice", Fujitora notably spearheaded a campaign for the abolishment of the "Seven Warlords of the Sea" system, which came to pass during the most recent Levely. Fujitora was first mentioned by Sakazuki when the latter was discussing plans to deal with Monkey D. Luffy and Trafalgar Law on Dressrosa. His following mission and actions on Dressrosa made him the first Admiral to physically appear post-timeskip and the secondary antagonist of the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Gedatsu
characters.short_bio: Sky Boss Gedatsu was one of Enel's priests who punished criminals with the Ordeal of Swamp during Enel's reign. He is a major antagonist during the Skypiea Arc, and later the central character from Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life Cover Page Serial. He now works at Ukkari Hot-Springs Resort.

characters.name: Hattori
characters.short_bio: Hattori is Rob Lucci's pet pigeon, and initially acted as the target of his ventriloquism.

characters.name: Dellinger
characters.short_bio: Dellinger is a combatant and an officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Diamante Army who is a hybrid between a human and a fighting fish fish-man. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Duval
characters.short_bio: Duval is the leader of the Rosy Life Riders (originally the Flying Fish Riders), active around the Sabaody Archipelago and Fish-Man Island. Initially an enemy of the Straw Hat Pirates due to a personal grudge against Sanji, he has since become their ally.

characters.name: Hajrudin
characters.short_bio: Hajrudin is a giant warrior described as being from the "new generation" of Elbaph. He is the illegitimate son of the late King Harald and his lover Ida, as well as the older half-brother of Prince Loki. A century after the Giant Warrior Pirates' disbandment, Hajrudin formed the New Giant Warrior Pirates in an attempt to revive the legendary crew; they formerly served as S-class pirate mercenaries for Buggy's Pirate Dispatch Organization. Hajrudin competed in the Corrida Colosseum on Dressrosa, where he would team up with Monkey D. Luffy and the Straw Hat Pirates to overthrow Donquixote Doflamingo's regime. Following this, Hajrudin swore his crew's allegiance to Luffy and became the captain of the sixth ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. He is a major ally during the Dressrosa and Elbaph Arcs, and one of the central characters of The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Don Sai
characters.short_bio: Sai, also known as Don Sai, is a member of the Chinjao Family and the 13th leader of the Happo Navy, as well as the captain of the third ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. He is also a martial artist who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi, where he met Monkey D. Luffy, whom he eventually pledged his loyalty to. He is now married to Baby 5, a former officer of the Donquixote Pirates who defected due to falling in love with him. He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc, and one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Machvise
characters.short_bio: Machvise is an officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Diamante Army. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Bomba
characters.short_bio: Bomba is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom. He is one of the two vice chiefs of the Tonta Corps along with Rampo, under Gancho and Leo, and serves under Leo in the Tontatta Pirates. He is the elder brother of Bobomba.

characters.name: Giberson
characters.short_bio: Giberson, known as "The Concealer", is a veteran warehouseman and one of the emperors of the Underworld.

characters.name: Jean Ango
characters.short_bio: Jean Ango, also known as Jean the Bandit, is a bounty hunter. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.

characters.name: Pisaro
characters.short_bio: Pisaro is the musician of the Arlong Pirates and an ocean sunfish fish-man. He was previously a member of the Sun Pirates.

characters.name: Bentham
characters.short_bio: :The subject of this article is often called "Bon Clay". Bentham of the Wild, alias Mr. 2 Bon Kurei, is a newkama and former Baroque Works officer agent. He was a major antagonist during the Arabasta Arc, and (along with his fellow Officer Agents) one of the central characters in Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works". While he was once an enemy of Luffy's as a member of Baroque Works, the two became quick friends, leading Bon Kurei to sacrifice himself for Luffy both at Arabasta and later at Impel Down, being one of his main allies during that Story Arc. He is currently the queen of Newkama Land.

characters.name: Sakazuki
characters.short_bio: Sakazuki, formerly known by his Admiral alias Akainu, is the current Fleet Admiral of the Marines, succeeding the previous Fleet Admiral, Sengoku. During the first half of the series, he was one of the three Admirals, and was the last one out of the three to debut. Upon becoming the Fleet Admiral, one of Sakazuki's first decisions was to relocate Marine Headquarters into the New World in preparation for the New Pirate Age. In the manga, Akainu was first mentioned by Nico Robin during the initial encounter with Aokiji. In the anime, he was mentioned earlier by Vice Admiral Jonathan during the anime-only G-8 Arc, which aired after Akainu had been revealed in the manga. Sakazuki is perhaps the strictest follower of Absolute Justice in the entire series, to the point where his extremism prompted his fellow Admiral Aokiji to oppose his promotion to Fleet Admiral and resign from the Marines after this effort failed. Due of his actions and role, Sakazuki is the main antagonist of the Marineford Arc and a major antagonist in the Final Saga and the second half of the series.

characters.name: Matsuge
characters.short_bio: :The subject of this article is sometimes called Eyelash. Matsuge is a Camel who accompanied the Straw Hat Pirates during the Arabasta Arc. He is classified as a Type-A creature, "Big Friendly".

characters.name: Pagaya
characters.short_bio: Pagaya is Conis' father and a native to Skypiea who fixed the waver that Nami rides.

characters.name: Wiper
characters.short_bio: "Berserker" Wyper is the former leader of the Shandia warriors that fought to take Upper Yard back from Enel. He is the direct descendant of Kalgara. He is an antagonist later turned ally during the Skypiea Arc. After the timeskip, he is one of God's Guards.

characters.name: Motobaro
characters.short_bio: Motobaro is the pet bison of Duval. He is used by Duval as a steed, and can also swim on water.

characters.name: Boo
characters.short_bio: Boo is a member of the Chinjao Family and the vice-leader of the Happo Navy. He is a martial artist who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi. He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Holdem
characters.short_bio: '''Holed'em''' is a Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates, who resides in Bakura Town. He is the son of Norinosuke, a Wano Country citizen. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc and a minor antagonist in the Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage cover story.

characters.name: Pound
characters.short_bio: Pound is Big Mom's 25th ex-husband and the father of Charlotte Chiffon and Lola. He is also the grandfather of Capone Pez and father-in-law of Capone Bege and Gotti. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Whole Cake Island Arc. He is also a major character in the "Gang" Bege's Oh My Family serial.

characters.name: Take
characters.short_bio: Take is a carp fish-man and is a member of the Arlong Pirates. He is the commander of parties.

characters.name: Vander Decken IX
characters.japanese_name: バンダー・デッケン九世
characters.short_bio: Vander Decken IX is the captain of the Flying Pirates on their ship, the Flying Dutchman, and the eighth descendant of the original Vander Decken of legend. He is a Japanese bullhead shark fish-man and the secondary antagonist of the Fish-Man Island Arc.

characters.name: Pell

devil_fruit.name: Tori Tori no Mi, Model: Falcon
devil_fruit.power: Allows him to transform into a falcon, flight, enhanced speed and strength, talons in combat.

characters.short_bio: Pell the Falcon is one of the two head guards in the Arabasta Kingdom that serve under Igaram, the other being Chaka. He is said to be the strongest fighter in all of Arabasta.

characters.name: Daigin
characters.short_bio: Daigin is a Marine Commodore who led the team that went to Impel Down to capture the intruder, Monkey D. Luffy.

characters.name: Kaya
characters.short_bio: Kaya is a young woman who lives in the largest mansion in Syrup Village on the Gecko Islands. She is a close friend of Usopp and is currently studying to become a doctor. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Syrup Village Arc.

characters.name: Corgi
characters.short_bio: Corgi is a World Government official who took part in the mission to acquire the blueprints of Pluton and escort the prisoners Nico Robin and Cutty Flam to Enies Lobby. He acted as the leader of the forces in the Sea Train, answering directly to the CP9 agents.

characters.name: Gatz
characters.short_bio: Gatz is the announcer at the Corrida Colosseum.

characters.name: Monet

devil_fruit.name: Yuki Yuki no Mi
devil_fruit.power: Create, control, and transform her body into snow.

characters.role: Caesar's secretary (Undercover); Doflamingo's spy; Pirate Officer
characters.short_bio: Monet was a scout and assistant for Caesar Clown and his underlings in the research facility on Punk Hazard. She was, in truth, a member and officer of the Donquixote Pirates and was sent as a deep cover agent by Doflamingo. She was also the older sister of Sugar. Due to her mission and actions, she could be regarded as the tertiary antagonist of the Punk Hazard Arc.

characters.name: Hannyabal
characters.short_bio: Hannyabal is the warden of Impel Down. Formerly the Vice Warden, he was promoted to Magellan's position following the mass breakout. Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Impel Down Arc.

characters.name: Farul
characters.short_bio: Farul is Cavendish's pet horse and a member of the Beautiful Pirates.

characters.name: Curly Dadan
characters.role: Mountain Bandit Boss; Caretaker of Monkey D. Luffy, Portgas D. Ace, and Sabo (former)
characters.short_bio: Curly Dadan is a mountain bandit and the boss of the Dadan Family who lives on Mt. Colubo near Foosha Village. She served as the foster mother of Portgas D. Ace and Monkey D. Luffy, who were entrusted to her by Monkey D. Garp, and also took care of Sabo too when he moved in. Dadan was first mentioned in the Post-Enies Lobby Arc, when Woop Slap read about Luffy and the Straw Hat Pirates waging war on the World Government.

characters.name: Cavendish
characters.epithet: "Cavendish of the White Horse" (白馬のキャベンディッシュ, Hakuba no Kyabendisshu?, VIZ: "White Knight Cavendish");"Pirate Prince" (海賊貴公子, Kaizoku Kikōshi?, VIZ: "Pirate Noble"; Funimation: "Pirate Nobleman")
characters.role: Captain of the First Ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet; Pirate Captain; Prince of the Bourgeois Kingdom (former)
characters.short_bio: Cavendish of the White Horse, also known as the "Pirate Prince", is a famous Super Rookie and the captain of the Beautiful Pirates. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi. After the final battle against Donquixote Doflamingo, Cavendish decided to pledge his loyalty to Monkey D. Luffy and became the captain of the first ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. He was formerly the prince of the Bourgeois Kingdom before he was exiled. He also suffers from a split personality, changing into a bloodthirsty lunatic known as Hakuba when his dominant personality sleeps. While initially antagonistic, he later becomes an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc, and one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Delacuaji
characters.short_bio: Delacuaji is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied with Whitebeard.

characters.name: Jewelry Bonney
characters.epithet: "Big Eater" (大喰らい, Ō-Gurai?, English versions: "Glutton")
characters.short_bio: Jewelry Bonney, also known as the "Big Eater", is a pirate from the South Blue and the captain of the Bonney Pirates. She is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation" and the only female member of the group. Bonney is the daughter of Ginny and the adopted daughter of Bartholomew Kuma, the former King of the Sorbet Kingdom (making her Sorbet's former princess). Thanks to experiments conducted by Jaygarcia Saturn of the Five Elders, Bonney acquired the powers of the Toshi Toshi no Mi, which allows her to manipulate the age of herself and others at will. She also inherited the Sapphire Scales disease from her mother, forcing her to live inside Kuma's church through her early childhood. After Kuma sacrificed his body and free will to the World Government in exchange for Dr. Vegapunk curing Bonney, she ventured forth from her home to become a pirate in search of her father, using her ability to appear as a young woman in her twenties, despite still being a little girl, having been ten years old during her debut and now being twelve after the timeskip.. Bonney eventually succeeded in reuniting with her father after he saved her life during the Egghead Incident. Upon reaching the Sabaody Archipelago, Bonney had a bounty of 140,000,000. Two years later, it was raised to 320,000,000. Bonney is a companion and major ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Egghead Arc and Elbaph Arc.

characters.name: Kiwi
characters.short_bio: Mozu and Kiwi, also known as the Square Sisters due to their square-like hairstyle, are two members of the Franky Family very loyal to Franky, who went with him everywhere and tended to mimic every pose he did. They are both allies of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 and beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc (starting off as minor antagonists in the former). Currently, they jointly manage Blueno's old bar in Water 7.

characters.name: Boa Hancock

devil_fruit.name: Love-Love Fruit
devil_fruit.power: Petrification of those attracted to her

characters.notable_info: Empress of Amazon Lily, former Warlord, in love with Luffy
characters.epithet: "Snake Princess" (蛇姫, Hebihime?);"Pirate Empress" (海賊女帝, Kaizoku Jotei?)
characters.role: Captain of the Kuja Pirates; Empress of Amazon Lily; Warlord of the Sea (former); Slave (former)
characters.short_bio: "Pirate Empress" Boa Hancock is the current captain of the Kuja Pirates and was the only female Warlord of the Sea before the organization's disbandment. She is the current empress of Amazon Lily, also known as the "Snake Princess". As the current empress she succeeds former empresses Tritoma, Shakuyaku, and Gloriosa. She rules over the Kuja tribe with her two younger sisters, Boa Sandersonia and Boa Marigold. Kidnapped by the World Nobles as a child along with her sisters, she was enslaved and tortured for years; during this time she was force-fed the Mero Mero no Mi, which gives her the ability to turn both living and non-living things into stone. She and her sisters escaped from Mary Geoise during a mass breakout instigated by Fisher Tiger. She was returned to her home with the help of Gloriosa, Silvers Rayleigh and Shakuyaku, where she would eventually become the island's empress, as well as one of the Seven Warlords. Though initially antagonistic towards Monkey D. Luffy, his selfless actions and animosity towards the Celestial Dragons caused her to befriend, and eventually fall in love, with him. She went on to serve as one of Luffy's most stalwart allies, helping him infiltrate Impel Down, siding with him in the Summit War of Marineford, providing him a location to train on for two years, and then helping him reunite with his crew and supporting him from afar. While employed within the Seven Warlords, she turned against the World Government on a number of occasions to support Luffy, though she was able to retain her title by feigning innocence. However, the Warlords were officially abolished after the most recent Levely, causing her to lose her status and became one of the world's most wanted criminals. Vegapunk was able to clone Hancock as one of the Seraphim, S-Snake, to replace the Warlords. She first gained a bounty of 80,000,000 due to her being a captain of the Kuja Pirates before it was frozen after she joined the Seven Warlords. However, after the abolition of the Seven Warlords, Hancock's bounty was reinstated and raised to 1,659,000,000. She initially serves as the main antagonist of the Amazon Lily Arc, before becoming a major ally for the rest of the Summit War Saga, as well as the Return to Sabaody Arc. She also acts as an ally of Luffy during the <s>3D</s>2Y special, the Cidre Guild filler Arc, and the movie One Piece: Stampede.

characters.name: Heppoko
characters.short_bio: Heppoko is a member of the Alvida Pirates and the triplet brother of Peppoko and Poppoko.

characters.name: Peppoko
characters.short_bio: Peppoko is a member of the Alvida Pirates and the triplet brother of Heppoko and Poppoko.

characters.name: Poppoko
characters.short_bio: Poppoko is a member of the Alvida Pirates and the triplet brother of Heppoko and Peppoko.

characters.name: Boa Sandersonia
characters.japanese_name: ボア・サンダーソニア
characters.short_bio: Boa Sandersonia is the younger sister of Boa Hancock, the ruler of Amazon Lily. She is also one of the second-in commands of the Kuja Pirates and the older sister of Boa Marigold. She and her sisters are referred to by the Kuja as the Gorgon Sisters.

characters.name: Brannew
characters.short_bio: Commodore Brannew is a Marine officer stationed at Marine Headquarters who assigns bounties to criminals. He was first introduced as a lieutenant commander during the Loguetown Arc, but was promoted to commodore during the timeskip.

characters.name: McGuy
characters.short_bio: "Thunder Lord" McGuy is an infamous New World pirate who allied with Whitebeard.

characters.name: Kumashi
characters.short_bio: :The subject of this article is sometimes referred to as "Kumacy". Kumashi was a stuffed bear zombie of the Thriller Bark Pirates who acted as Perona's servant and the commander-in-chief of the Wild Zombies prior to being purified by Usopp.

characters.name: Wanze
characters.epithet: "Mad Wanze" (マッドなワンゼ, Maddona Wanze?)
characters.short_bio: Wanze is an agent of CP7 and a cook, specializing in making ramen noodles. He was one of the antagonists during the Sea Train voyage in the Water 7 Arc.

characters.name: Boa Marigold
characters.japanese_name: ボア・マリーゴールド
characters.short_bio: Boa Marigold is the younger sister of Boa Hancock, the ruler of Amazon Lily. She is also one of the second-in commands of the Kuja Pirates and the younger sister of Boa Sandersonia. She and her sisters are referred to by the Kuja as the Gorgon Sisters.

characters.name: Crocodile
characters.short_bio: "Desert King" Sir Crocodile is a former Warlord of the Sea and the former president of the mysterious crime syndicate Baroque Works, formerly operating under the codename "Mr. 0". During his time as Warlord, Crocodile maintained a public facade of an ally to both the people of Arabasta Kingdom and the Marines, all while running Baroque Works in secret with the express purpose of overthrowing Arabasta via Operation Utopia. When his plot was foiled by the Straw Hat Pirates, he was stripped of his title and imprisoned in the deepest level of the legendary prison Impel Down. His former partner and Vice-President of Baroque Works, Nico Robin, would go on to become a member of the Straw Hat Pirates. Crocodile was freed by Luffy from Impel Down in exchange for aiding in the rescue of his brother and went to Marineford to participate in the Summit War. While initially aiming to kill Whitebeard, his contempt for the Marines led him to ally with Luffy and the Whitebeard Pirates. After the war, he and his subordinate Daz Bonez escaped from Marineford and decided to head out to the New World. After the disbandment of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, Crocodile now works as a co-leader of the Cross Guild alongside Dracule Mihawk and under the figurehead leadership of Buggy, who was mistakenly made one of the Four Emperors. Sometime prior to the disbanding of the Warlords, Vegapunk cloned Crocodile as one of the Seraphim to replace the Warlords. He is one of the longest running and most noteworthy primary adversaries of the series, being the first enemy to hand Luffy a complete and utter defeat. He is the main antagonist of the Arabasta Arc and the Arabasta Saga overall, a tentative ally in both the Impel Down and Marineford Arcs, and a supporting antagonist in the Final Saga.

characters.name: Macro
characters.short_bio: Macro is a pelican eel fish-man and the captain of the Macro Pirates. He first appeared in Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll cover story. He was also a member of the Sun Pirates.

characters.name: Squard
characters.epithet: "Maelstrom Spider" (大渦蜘蛛, Ō Uzu Gumo?, English versions: Whirl Spider)
characters.short_bio: "Maelstrom Spider" Squard is an infamous New World pirate and the captain of the Maelstrom Spider Pirates. Squard and his crew were allies of the Whitebeard Pirates and participated in the Summit War of Marineford.

characters.name: Fullbody
characters.short_bio: "Double Ironfist" Fullbody is a Marine lieutenant commander serving under Rear Admiral Hina. He was a Marine Headquarters lieutenant at the start of the series, but was demoted to seaman recruit as a condition when he helped the former Black Cat pirate, Jango, get acquitted for his past crimes (in the anime, it was after getting into a fight with Sanji on the Baratie). During the timeskip, however, he rose back through the ranks to become a commissioned officer once again, being one rank higher than he was to begin with in the series. Due to his actions, he is a minor antagonist during the Baratie and Arabasta Arcs. He also is a supporting character during Jango's Dance Paradise Cover Page Serial.

characters.name: Motzel
characters.short_bio: Mr. Motzel is a gourmand and one of the known customers of the Baratie.

characters.name: Cabaji
characters.epithet: "Cabaji the Acrobat" (曲芸のカバジ, Kyokugi no Kabaji?)
characters.role: Pirate; Chief of Staff; Acrobat; Swordsman
characters.short_bio: Cabaji the Acrobat is the Buggy Pirates chief of staff, as well as an acrobat swordsman. He was a member of Buggy's Delivery, and is currently a member of Cross Guild. Due to his actions, he can be considered the tertiary antagonist of the Orange Town Arc, and a minor antagonist in the Loguetown Arc.

characters.name: Kureha
characters.epithet: "Witch" (魔女, Majo?);"Master of Doctors" (マスターオブ医者, Masutā Obu Isha?)
characters.role: Head-Doctor of the Sakura Kingdom; Leader of the Isshi-100
characters.short_bio: Dr. Kureha is an elderly doctor who works on Drum Island. She is referred to as "witch" by some people. She is Tony Tony Chopper's mentor and adoptive mother, taking him under her care after the death of Hiriluk. She is also head of the Isshi-100. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Drum Island Arc.

characters.name: Rakuyo
characters.short_bio: Rakuyo is the former 7th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.

characters.name: Basil Hawkins
characters.short_bio: Basil Hawkins is an infamous pirate from North Blue known as the "Magician" and the captain of the Hawkins Pirates. He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation". Hawkins attempted to create a Pirate Alliance with Eustass Kid and Scratchmen Apoo but he was betrayed by the latter who had secretly become a subordinate of the Emperor Kaidou. Defeated by Kaidou, Hawkins joined the Beasts Pirates and became one of the crew's Shinuchi. His previous known bounty amounted to 249,000,000, but after the timeskip, it was raised to 320,000,000. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Manjaro
characters.short_bio: Manjaro is a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew and masqueraded as Roronoa Zoro. When the crew switched to posing as the Kid Pirates, Manjaro impersonated Heat.

characters.name: O-Kiku
characters.epithet: "Kikunojo of the Lingering Snow" (残雪の菊之丞, Zansetsu no Kikunojō?, English: "Kikunojo of the Fallen Snow")
characters.role: Daimyo of Ringo; Samurai; Retainer of the Kouzuki Family; Tea House Poster Girl
characters.short_bio: Kikunojo of the Lingering Snow, more commonly referred to as Kiku, is a samurai from Wano Country and a retainer for the Kouzuki Family, serving as one of Kouzuki Oden's Nine Red Scabbards. She is also the younger sister of Izou and the daughter of the dancing school head of the Hanayanagi School in Ringo. After traveling forward in time, she worked as a tea house poster girl in Okobore Town while gathering information for the planned rebellion. She participated in the Raid on Onigashima where she battled Kaidou alongside the other Scabbards, losing her left arm to one of Kaidou's attacks. Following Kouzuki Momonosuke's ascent to shogun, she serves as the daimyo of Ringo. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Shyarly
characters.epithet: Madam Shyarly (マダム・シャーリー, Madamu Shārī?)
characters.role: Proprietor of the Mermaid Cafe; Fortune teller (former)
characters.short_bio: Madam Shyarly is a shortfin mako shark mermaid living on Fish-Man Island. She is the proprietor of the Mermaid Cafe and Arlong's younger half-sister. She used to be a fortune teller until she decided to discard her crystal ball.

characters.name: T-Bone
characters.short_bio: "Ship Cutter" T Bone was a Marine Vice Admiral. As a Marine Captain two years ago, he was a minor antagonist during the Water 7 Arc and confronted the Straw Hat Pirates on the Sea Train route to Enies Lobby. Prior to joining the Marines, he was a royal knight. Sometime around the Egghead Arc, T Bone was killed in the Pepe Kingdom for the bounty he received from the Cross Guild.

characters.name: Very Good
characters.short_bio: Very Good is a Marine Captain and one of the Marines who helped to attack the Straw Hat Pirates during the Buster Call at Enies Lobby.

characters.name: Mont Blanc Cricket
characters.japanese_name: モンブラン・クリケット
characters.short_bio: Mont Blanc Cricket is an inhabitant of Jaya, living in a small home behind the façade of a castle. He is the distant descendant of Mont Blanc Noland and the of the Saruyama Alliance. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Jaya Arc, and led the Saruyama Alliance in helping them reach Skypiea.

characters.name: Morley
characters.epithet: "Morley of Fur" (毛皮のモーリー, Kegawa no Mōrī?)
characters.role: West Army Commander of the Revolutionary Army; Pirate (former); Prisoner of Impel Down (former)
characters.short_bio: Morley of Fur is a giant and a newkama, as well as the commander of the West Army in the Revolutionary Army. Morley's existence was first alluded by Emporio Ivankov during the Impel Down Arc, as the one responsible for the creation of Newkama Land.

characters.name: Curiel
characters.short_bio: Curiel is the former 10th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.

characters.name: Hoe
characters.short_bio: Hoe is the pet whale of King Neptune who uses him as a means of transportation. The only word he can say is his own name.

characters.name: Lord of the Coast
characters.short_bio: The Lord of the Coast is a Sea King that inhabits the waters of Dawn Island, typically near Foosha Village. He is classified as a Type C creature, "Big Savage".

characters.name: O-Tsuru
characters.short_bio: Tsurujo, commonly known as O-Tsuru, is a tea house owner who lives in the Kuri region in Wano Country. She is also the wife of Kin'emon.

characters.name: Spoil
characters.short_bio: Spoil is the chairman of the Thriller Bark Victim's Association.

characters.name: Laboon
characters.short_bio: Laboon is an Island Whale the Straw Hat Pirates encounter immediately after entering the Grand Line. He is native to the West Blue and is classified as a Type A creature, "Big Friendly", and at the top of both the size and friendliness scale. 50 years ago, after being separated from his pod as a baby, Laboon became a close companion of the Rumbar Pirates, but he had to be left behind under Crocus's care due to the dangers of the Grand Line. The pirates promised they would come back for Laboon someday, so the whale still awaits their return to this day. As a former and the only surviving member of the Rumbar Pirates, it is Brook's ultimate goal to reunite with Laboon. Because many events of the Reverse Mountain Arc happen within his innards, Laboon could be considered one of the main settings for that story arc alongside the Twin Cape.

characters.name: Rindo
characters.short_bio: Rindo is a member of the Kuja Pirates.

characters.name: Kuina
characters.short_bio: Shimotsuki Kuina was a childhood friend, relative and rival of Roronoa Zoro. She was the daughter of Shimotsuki Koushirou and the granddaughter of Shimotsuki Kouzaburou making her a descendant of Wano Country's famed Shimotsuki Family. Her death at the age of eleven drove much of Zoro's ambitions as a swordsman, including his development of the Three Sword Style.

characters.name: Devil Dias
characters.short_bio: Devil Dias is a pirate and the former captain of the Acumate Pirates, but was captured and sold as a slave to the family of World Noble Saint Rosward.

characters.name: Karasu
characters.role: North Army Commander of the Revolutionary Army
characters.short_bio: Karasu is a member of the Revolutionary Army, serving as one of its executive officers and the commander of the North Army.

characters.name: Don Krieg
characters.short_bio: Don Krieg is the admiral of the Krieg Pirates, widely reputed as Foul-Play Krieg for his underhanded methods. At his height, he was also known as the Pirate Fleet Admiral, commanding a fleet of fifty ships (totaling some 5,000 pirates) throughout the East Blue. After effectively dominating East Blue piracy, Krieg attempted to conquer the Grand Line, only to have his fleet decimated by Dracule Mihawk of the Seven Warlords of the Sea. Fleeing back to the East Blue, he tried to capture the Baratie as his new ship, but met further defeat from Monkey D. Luffy. Taken away from the Baratie by his right-hand man Gin, Krieg continued his pirating career, eventually arriving at the pirate island Hachinosu. Due to his actions and role, he is the main antagonist of the Baratie Arc.

characters.name: Shura
characters.short_bio: "Sky Rider" Shura was one of the four priests of the Upper Yard, who punished criminals with the Ordeal of String during Enel's reign. He rode a giant flying bird named Fuza. He is a major antagonist during the Skypiea Arc.

characters.name: Chocolat
characters.short_bio: Chocolat is a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who masqueraded as Nami.

characters.name: Kuzan
characters.role: Titanic Captain (Captain of the Tenth Ship); Admiral (former); Vice Admiral (former)
characters.short_bio: Kuzan, better known by his alias Aokiji, is one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates, serving as the captain of the tenth ship of the fleet. Before joining Blackbeard's crew, he served as a Marine Admiral, having been taught by Monkey D. Garp. He was nominated by Sengoku for the position of Fleet Admiral; however, after fighting Sakazuki for the position and losing, Kuzan resigned from the Marines. Kuzan was the antagonist of the second part of the Long Ring Long Land Arc; in the anime, he is instead one of the main antagonists of the Foxy's Return Arc. He is later a secondary antagonist of the Marineford Arc, a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

characters.name: Pappag
characters.short_bio: Pappag is a starfish who is Camie's pet and teacher. He is the creator of the Criminal fashion line and is mentoring Camie to be a fashion designer.

characters.name: Kyros
characters.short_bio: Kyros is a legendary gladiator who fought in the Corrida Colosseum until he left to become captain of the royal army of Dressrosa. He was later turned into a toy, causing everyone to forget his existence, becoming a One-Legged Soldier, also known as the "Thunder Soldier of Rage". He is the former captain of the Riku Royal Army, the father of Rebecca, the husband of Scarlett, and the son-in-law of Riku Doldo III. He spent ten years as a toy before being freed by the success of his own Operation SOP. After helping bring down the Donquixote Pirates, Kyros currently lives with Rebecca. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Hanger
characters.short_bio: Hanger is an employee at Robecca Hanberg, a clothing store in Loguetown. Nami tried on all of his best clothes, but did not buy any.

characters.name: Orochi

devil_fruit.name: Hebi Hebi no Mi, Model: Yamata no Orochi
devil_fruit.power: Allows him to transform into a eight-headed snake and a human-eight-headed snake hybrid at will. Can survive decapitation up to 8 times.

characters.short_bio: Kurozumi Orochi was the former shogun of Wano Country and one of the last members of the Kurozumi Family. Persecuted in his youth due to his grandfather's failed attempt to seize the shogunate from the Kouzuki Family, Orochi encountered some relatives who helped him formulate another attempt to become shogun. This plan succeeded, with Orochi deposing the Kouzuki Family around three decades before the present day after allying with Kaidou of the Four Emperors. Orochi ruled Wano tyrannically until he was deposed by none other than Kaidou, who betrayed him to seize Wano for himself; Orochi survived Kaidou's attack and tried to kill everyone on Onigashima out of spite but was then killed after two encounters with the Kouzuki Family's Nine Red Scabbards who he knew had been prophesied to overthrow him. Due to his actions and role, he is the secondary antagonist of the first half and a supporting antagonist in the second half of the Wano Country Arc, and one of the major antagonists of the Wano Country Saga overall.

characters.name: Umit
characters.short_bio: "Deep-Sea Currents" Umit is a magnate who presides Umit Shipping and one of the emperors of the Underworld.

characters.name: Black Maria
characters.short_bio: Black Maria is one of the Tobiroppo, the strongest six Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates. She owns her own brothel on Onigashima near Kaidou's castle. Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Jean Goen
characters.short_bio: Jean Goen is a prisoner on Level 1 of Impel Down.

characters.name: Suu
characters.short_bio: Suu (Funimation)}} :The subject of this article is sometimes romanized as Suu. Su is a Cloud Fox and pet of Conis.

characters.name: Terracotta
characters.short_bio: Terracotta is Igaram's wife and the royal head chef who appeared very late in the Arabasta Arc. She is also the royal seamstress. Her friend and helper is Maidy.

characters.name: Cosmos
characters.short_bio: Cosmos is a member of the Kuja Pirates.

characters.name: Dagama
characters.short_bio: Dagama is the tactician of the Prodence Kingdom. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi. He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Mr. 9
characters.short_bio: Mr. 9 is the code name of a former Frontier Agent and bounty hunter of Baroque Works, and Miss Wednesday's former assigned partner during her infiltration. Due to his actions, he is one of the main antagonists of the Reverse Mountain Arc, and a supporting antihero in the Whisky Peak Arc. After the fall of Baroque Works, he stayed at Whisky Peak, and eventually bore a son with Miss Monday.

characters.name: Jack
characters.epithet: "Jack the Drought" (旱害のジャック, Kangai no Jakku?)
characters.role: All-Star; Captain of the Mammoth; De Facto Ruler of Kuri (former)
characters.short_bio: Jack the Drought is a giant grouper fish-man, an All-Star of the Beasts Pirates as one of Kaidou's three closest confidants, and captain of the Mammoth, prior to its destruction. He was formerly the ruler of Kuri region in Wano Country. He was first briefly mentioned when being notified of Caesar Clown's capture by viewers of Caesar's broadcast of the Punk Hazard incident. Due to his actions and role, he is the main antagonist of the Zou Arc, and a major antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

characters.name: Stalker
characters.short_bio: Lieutenant Junior Grade Stalker is a Marine on Vice Admiral Momonga's ship.

characters.name: Charlotte Cabaletta
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Cabaletta is the eighth son and the 13th child of the Charlotte Family and the fourth quintuplet brother of Opera, Counter, Cadenza, and Gala. He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.

characters.name: Charlotte Cadenza
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Cadenza is the seventh son and the twelfth child of the Charlotte Family and the third quintuplet brother of Opera, Counter, Cabaletta, and Gala. He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.

characters.name: Charlotte Counter
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Counter is the sixth son and the 11th child of the Charlotte Family and the second quintuplet brother of Opera, Cadenza, Cabaletta, and Gala. He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.

characters.name: Charlotte Gala
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Gala is the ninth son and the 14th child of the Charlotte Family and the youngest quintuplet brother of Opera, Counter, Cadenza, and Cabaletta.

characters.name: Charlotte Opera
characters.short_bio: Charlotte Opera is the fifth son and the tenth child of the Charlotte Family and is the eldest quintuplet brother of Counter, Cadenza, Cabaletta, and Gala. He also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates and served as Totto Land's Minister of Whipped Cream, governing over Noko Island. His current status is unknown after having his lifespan removed by a rampaging Big Mom. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Whole Cake Island Arc.

characters.name: Drug Peclo
characters.short_bio: Drug Peclo, also known as the Major Undertaker, is an emperor of the Underworld.

characters.name: Pinky
characters.short_bio: Monstrous Bird Pinky is a giant bird that appeared in the Orange Town Arc. He is classified as a Type C creature, "Big Savage".

characters.name: Avalo Pizarro

devil_fruit.name: Shima Shima no Mi
devil_fruit.power: Allows him to assimilate his body into an island itself and control its natural environment and artificial structures.

characters.role: Titanic Captain (Captain of the Fourth Ship)
characters.short_bio: Avalo Pizarro, also known as the "Corrupt King", is one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates, serving as the captain of the fourth ship of the fleet. Prior to his life of crime, he was once a king of a North Blue kingdom that eventually overthrew him for his despotic ways. He was then imprisoned in Impel Down and given a life sentence in Level 6, as his crimes were so atrocious, he had to effectively be erased from history. He has since been freed by Marshall D. Teach and has become a member of his crew. Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Marineford Arc, a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

characters.name: Comil
characters.short_bio: Vice Admiral Comil is the commander of Marine Base G-2. He first appeared in Portgas D. Ace's cover story, and later took part in the Summit War of Marineford.

characters.name: Mohji
characters.epithet: Beast Tamer (猛獣使いのモージ, Mōjū-tsukai no Mōji?);Beast Breaker (4Kids)
characters.short_bio: Mohji the Beast Tamer is a pirate and the first mate of the Buggy Pirates and a member of the Buggy and Alvida Alliance. He is a pet tamer, usually accompanied by his pet lion Richie. He was a member of Buggy's Delivery, and now currently a member of Cross Guild. Due to his actions, he can be considered the secondary antagonist of the Orange Town Arc, and a minor antagonist in the Loguetown Arc.

characters.name: Dorry
characters.epithet: Dorry the Blue Ogre (青鬼のドリー, Ao-Oni no Dorī?)
characters.short_bio: Dorry the Blue Ogre is a giant from Elbaph and one of the two captains of the Giant Warrior Pirates alongside Brogy. Once an active and infamous threat in the seas long ago, Dorry became embroiled in a personal duel over a trivial dispute with his best friend and co-captain Brogy. This duel on Little Garden lasted for a century before being interrupted by the arrival of the Straw Hat Pirates and the machinations of Baroque Works. After finally settling their duel the two giant captains returned to Elbaph and their crew, and later became involved in the Egghead Incident to rescue the Straw Hat Pirates and bring them to safety to Elbaph. A century ago his bounty was 100,000,000, but due to years of inflation and a return to active piracy his bounty was updated to 1,800,000,000. He is a major ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Little Garden, Egghead, and Elbaph Arcs. However, after being transformed into a demon by Imu, he became a minor antagonist during the Elbaph Arc.

characters.name: Tonjit
characters.short_bio: Tonjit is an elderly nomad belonging to a tribe that lives on Long Ring Long Land.

characters.name: Yama
characters.short_bio: Yama is a Birkan and the commander of the Divine Soldiers under Enel. He is a supporting antagonist during the Skypiea Arc.

characters.name: Calgara
characters.short_bio: Kalgara was a warrior of the Shandia who lived on Jaya around 400 years ago. He was renowned among his people as the "Great Warrior of Shandora" and feared as the "Demon of Shandora" by outsiders. During his life, he befriended the later infamous explorer Mont Blanc Noland, and the two promised to meet again. However, both men met tragic ends before this promise could be fulfilled. Kalgara died in battle against the Skypiean forces after a part of Jaya was sent to the sky by the Knock Up Stream. Until his final moments, he regretted being unable to ring the Golden Bell to signal their presence to Noland. His legacy lived on after his death, as a statue of him was erected in the Hidden Cloud Village. His bloodline also continued through his daughter Mousse, and Wyper is his descendant.

characters.name: Oars
characters.epithet: "Devil" (魔人, Majin?, VIZ: "Beast");"Oars the Continent-Puller" (国引きオーズ, Kunihiki Ōzu?)
characters.role: Special Zombie; Leader of clan of evil giants (former)
characters.short_bio: :The subject of this article is sometimes incorrectly called "Oz", "Ozu" and "Ohz". Oars the Continent-Puller was an infamous ancient giant who was born over 500 years ago. After he died, his body was unearthed by the Thriller Bark Pirates and was subsequently revived by Gecko Moria as Zombie #900, a Special Zombie. As the member of Moria's army animated using the stolen shadow of Monkey D. Luffy, he was a major obstacle that the Straw Hat Pirates had to overcome during their adventure on Thriller Bark. He is the direct ancestor of Little Oars Jr. Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist of the Thriller Bark Arc.

characters.name: Shandia Chief
characters.short_bio: The Shandia chief is the leader of the Shandia tribe.

characters.name: Kokoro
characters.short_bio: :Not to be confused with Kokoro no Chizu, the 5th opening song Kokoro is an icefish mermaid and the stationmaster for Shift Station, a Sea Train station near Water 7. She was also Tom's secretary during the days of Tom's Workers. Kokoro poses as a human, hiding her mermaid physique because her tail fin forked in two around the age of 30 and allowed her to walk on land. She has a granddaughter named Chimney, who accompanies her everywhere. She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Water 7 Arc and, later on, the Enies Lobby Arc.

characters.name: Marco

devil_fruit.name: Bird-Bird Fruit, Model: Phoenix
devil_fruit.japanese_name: Tori Tori no Mi, Model: Phoenix

characters.short_bio: Marco the Phoenix is the former 1st division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates. Once starting out as an apprentice on the crew, he eventually came to be Whitebeard's closest confidant and right-hand man. After his captain's death during the Summit War of Marineford, Marco assumed leadership of the Whitebeard Pirates until the crew's disbandment following the Payback War. In the year since the disbandment, Marco worked as a doctor in Whitebeard's home village on Sphinx; following the Raid on Onigashima, during which Marco acted as an ally to the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance, Marco permanently retired from piracy, returning to his duties as a doctor on Sphinx. Marco is a major ally during the Marineford and Wano Country Arcs.

characters.name: Monkey D. Dragon
characters.japanese_name: モンキー・D（ディー）・ドラゴン
characters.epithet: "Rebellious Dragon" (反逆竜, Hangyaku Ryū?, Funimation: "The Insurgent Serpent")"World's Worst Criminal" (世界最悪の犯罪者, Sekai Saiaku no Hanzaisha?, Funimation: "World's Most Heinous Criminal")
characters.role: Supreme Commander of the Revolutionary Army;Captain of the Freedom Fighters (former)
characters.short_bio: Monkey D. Dragon, also known as the "Rebellious Dragon", is the infamous supreme commander and founder of the Revolutionary Army (originally the Freedom Fighters). A former Marine, his disgust with the organization's actions in the God Valley Incident, and its brutality in the Ohara Incident led to him forming the Revolutionary Army to oppose the World Government in its entirety. Having campaigned toward its downfall for over thirty years, he is labeled the "'''World's Worst Criminal'''". Dragon is the father of Monkey D. Luffy and the son of Monkey D. Garp, and likewise was born and raised in the Goa Kingdom. He was also responsible for saving Sabo's life after a World Noble attack, eventually raising the boy into his second-in-command. Dragon was first introduced in the Loguetown Arc, where he helped Luffy escape from Marine captain Smoker's clutches. Since then, he has periodically appeared as a key background character.

characters.name: O-Toko
characters.short_bio: Toko is a girl who lives in the Flower Capital of Wano Country and is under the care of Kouzuki Hiyori. She is the adopted daughter of the late former daimyo of Hakumai, Shimotsuki Yasuie, and thus a member of the Shimotsuki Family. She worked as a kamuro for Hiyori, who was living as the courtesan "Komurasaki", until Toko angered Shogun Kurozumi Orochi and was driven out of the Flower Capital. After the Beasts Pirates' fall from power and Orochi's death, she returned to live in the Flower Capital with Hiyori.

characters.name: Van Augur
characters.role: Titanic Captain (Captain of the Third Ship); Sniper
characters.short_bio: Van Augur, nicknamed "The Supersonic", is the sniper, and one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates, serving as the captain of the third ship of the fleet. Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Jaya Arc, a supporting antagonist in the Impel Down and Marineford Arcs, a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

characters.name: Bartolomeo
characters.epithet: "Bartolomeo the Cannibal" (人食いのバルトロメオ, Hitokui no Barutoromeo?, Viz: "Man-Eater Bartolomeo")
characters.role: Captain of the Second Ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet; Pirate Captain; Mafia Leader (former)
characters.short_bio: Bartolomeo the Cannibal is a Super Rookie, the captain of the Barto Club and the captain of the second ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. He joined as a gladiator to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi at the Corrida Colosseum, where he met Monkey D. Luffy and pledged his loyalty towards him after winning the B Block. After a confrontation with the Red Hair Pirates his ship the Going Luffy-senpai was destroyed leaving his fate along with his crew unknown. Formerly a mob boss from the East Blue, Bartolomeo witnessed Luffy miraculously escaping the execution Buggy had prepared for him during the events of the Loguetown Arc, a scene that changed Bartolomeo's life and turned him into a major fan of the Straw Hat Pirates. He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc, the beginning of the Zou Arc, the non-canon Silver Mine Arc, and the movies One Piece: Stampede and One Piece Film: Red. He is also one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial. After becoming a pirate he gained a bounty of 150,000,000 as a Super Rookie, later increasing to 200,000,000 at the end of the Dressrosa Arc.

characters.name: Tashigi
characters.notable_info: Marine Captain, swordswoman, Smoker's subordinate
characters.role: Captain; Ensign (former); Master Chief Petty Officer (former)
characters.short_bio: Captain Tashigi is a Marine officer serving under Vice Admiral Smoker in the base of G-5, as well as a member and Captain of G-5 Branch's Unit 01. She was originally introduced as a Master Chief Petty Officer in Loguetown but was promoted to Ensign after the events in Arabasta. During the timeskip, she was promoted to Captain. Due to her actions, she can be considered a supporting antagonist during the Loguetown Arc, but she and Smoker temporarily teamed up with the Straw Hats during the end of the Arabasta Saga and the Punk Hazard Arc.

characters.name: Trafalgar D. Water Law
characters.japanese_name: トラファルガー・D・ワーテル・ロー

devil_fruit.name: Op-Op Fruit
devil_fruit.power: Create a spherical space for operations

characters.notable_info: Former Warlord, surgical powers, alliance with Straw Hats
characters.short_bio: Trafalgar D. Water Law, more commonly known as just Trafalgar Law and by his epithet as the "Surgeon of Death", is a pirate from the North Blue and the captain and doctor of the Heart Pirates. He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation".
